loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling motorcycle spare parts and accessories in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Shirley joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica Y. sells tinned tomatoes, cooking oil, onions and eggs in Takoradi. Veronica has been through senior high school. She is married to a mason and lives together with her two children. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Osiris Antonia

texts.es:
Osiris B. está esperando su crédito solicitado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar dos lavadoras y ampliar su negocio. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su hijo de 12 años  y como mujer cabeza de familia,   día y noche hace maravillas  para salir adelante con él,  especialmente en lo relacionado con el tema educativo.
Se inició como negociante vendiendo carne, queso y pescado traídos desde el departamento de Sucre, donde afirma ella, se consiguen los mejores de Colombia,  luego agregó a su actividad productiva un nuevo negocio; compró dos lavadoras  que puso al servicio de la comunidad mediante su alquiler y que hoy desea expandir porque le ha ido muy bien. Fue desde este momento en el que decidió ingresar a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante un crédito que le representó una nueva alternativa de ingreso y que ahora quiere hacer crecer para tener mas ingresos.
Su sueño y desafío es que su hijo y sus sobrinos puedan tener una carrera profesional, que les permita ser útiles a la sociedad, su mayor preocupación es el estado de salud de su madre  de la que ella siempre está pendiente.
texts.en:
Osiris B. is waiting for the loan she requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy two washing machines to expand her business. She is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Cartagena with her 12 year old son. As a female head of household, she does a wondrous job day and night of helping her son move forward, especially when it comes to seeing that he receives an education.

Osiris started working as a merchant who sells meat, cheese, and fish brought in from the department of Sucre. She claims these products are the best in Colombia. Osiris later added a new business to her busy schedule. She bought two washing machines that could be rented out to the community. Now she wants to expand this business since it is doing very well. From that moment, she decided to approach Fundación Mario Santo Domingo about a loan since this represented a new alternative source of capital. Now she wants to continue growing so that she can have more income.

Her dream and challenge is seeing her son and her nephews pursue professional degrees so that they can become useful members of society. However, her greatest worry is the state of her mother’s health which has been declining.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two washing machines to expand her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica B.'s main source of income comes from cultivating and harvesting flowers for sale. She is 23 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City. Veronica has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Señora Julia nacida el 23 de Junio de 1954 en Chuquisaca(Monteagudo), con 2 hijos con viviente con don Primitivo hace 10 años que tiene su tierra en Betanzo a 35 Km de Limoncito en la cual se dedican a la agricultura juntamente con su esposo y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la simbra, cosecha y el la comercializacion de los productos en el mercado del Torno y tambien en los mercados de Santa Cruz,Ella hace 4 años que trabaja con Emprender, con el mdinero del credito comprara una motosierra y para mano de obra para la cosecha de frutas como la sandia, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado, en la foto la Sra. Julia esta acompañada con su Esposo.
texts.en:
Julia, was born in Chuquisaca (Monteagudo), on June 23, 1954. She lives with her husband, Primitivo, and her two children. For 10 years, she has had her land in Betazon, 35 kilometers from Limoncito, where she, her husband, and children, who help them, raise, harvest, and sell their products in the markets in Torno and Santa Cruz. She’s been working with Emprender for four years and will use the money from this loan to buy a motorbike and to pay for labor to harvest fruits, such as watermelon. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has given her. Julia is accompanied by her husband in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorbike and labor

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. lives in the Kimwanyi zone in Katanga Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married  to a primary school teacher. They have 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Sarah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she works 7 days a week. Sarah sells her products, retail, at the market. She has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy additional bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through a catering business.

The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation costs. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a successful business lady. She decided to join MCDT because she is trustworthy. Sarah lives in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Luis Albert

texts.es: El Sr. Luis y su esposa Ana Celia  se   dedican  a la atención de una Licorería,   viven en la  casa  de un  familiar,  tienen una hija de ocho añitos. Además el señor Luis  percibe otro ingreso por que da a trabajar su vehículo o a veces el  lo trabaja, y el crédito actual es para la compra de un motor y reparación de su vehículo. El Sr. Luis C., es una persona  que trabaja mucho junto con su esposa, se esfuerzan para salir adelante por el bienestar y futuro de su hija, esta muy agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Luis and his wife, Ana Celia, run a liquor store. They live in a family member’s house, and they have an eight year old daughter. Luis also gets another income from letting others work in his vehicle, and sometimes he works with it. The current loan is to buy a motor and to repair his vehicle. Luis C. is a person who works a lot together with his wife. They try very hard to get ahead for their daughter’s well-being and her future. He is very grateful for the trust shown in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor and to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Juntas son D. la comunidad D. Pilpichaca.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocio como la venta D. ropa, animales y comida.
Como es el caso D. la señora Teresa que es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Teresa venD. ropa variada para varones y mujeres, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias D. su región, sus productos los compra en la ciudad D. Lima y Huancayo a donD. viaja mensualmente, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Teresa solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños D. Teresa son ahorrar lo suficiente para tener su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the Trabajando Juntas communal bank are from the community of Pilpichaca. The members are engaged in various businesses such as clothing sales, raising animals, and food services. Teresa is married and has 6 children. She sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing at the regional markets. With her children along to help her, she travels monthly to the cities of Lima y Huancayo to buy her merchandise. Teresa is requesting this loan to purchase sweaters, trousers, and coats. Teresa dreams of saving enough money to have her business at her home. .

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de chompas, pantalones y casacas. To purchase sweaters, trousers, and coats.

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina P. is from the town of Aurora. She is 49 years old. Darlina is married and has 11 children. Her eldest child is 31 years old while the youngest is only 3. To make a living, Darlina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Darlina also put up a sari-sari store to add to their income. She says that with a family as big as hers, it is difficult to send all the children to school but she works hard to be able to do it.

Darlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Darlina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela D. R. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Romela is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Romela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Romela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Romela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romela is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Romela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre, Mujeres Emprendedoras se conformó en fecha 17 de mayo del 2.006, mediante las promociones que realizó la Asesora en la zona, y gracias a la actual Directora General se conformó el Comité, que se encuentra integrado hoy día por 20 mujeres y  siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiasmo y esfuerzo,  ya se encuentra el 15º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo tienen un excelente comportamiento de pago, y el trato entre ellas es memorable, gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Marciana quien se dedica al comercio minorista desde su casa donde ofrece mercaderías como productos de consumo familias, bebidas, artículos de mercería, librería y otros, su negocio es muy completo por lo que los clientes prefieren visitar su negocio.
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su negocio y con su grupo, comenta que ha desarrollado mucho su capacidad de trabajo, participación, responsabilidad ya que trabajan en grupo, y eso ayuda a la formación personal de cada señora.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa, como bebidas en general, aceites, yerba mate, enlatados, golosinas, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprdedoras” (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank was formed on the 17th of May in 2006.  The group formed through the promotions that the consultant made and thanks to the current general director.  Today the group is comprised of 20 women.  They continue working with the same enthusiasm and effort.  They are in their 15th cycle.  They work within the program as a cohesive and united group.

The group has excellent payment performance.  Thanks to the memorable way they treat each other and their supportive work they continue on increasing their income and working with the program.

Marciana is one of the members.  She is a small businesswoman.  She sells merchandise like goods for families and babies, notions, bookstore items, and other things.  Her business is replete, and that is why her customers prefer to shop in her business.

She is very satisfied with her business and with her group.  She says that she has greatly developed her capacity to work, participate, and be responsible.  This is because they work as a group, and that helps each woman with their personal development.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy things like drinks, oil, tea, canned goods, sweets, and other items.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise, drinks, canned goods, oil, dairy products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Jane has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.  She also sells food.  

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  

In the future, Jane hopes to own a retail shop.  Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to handle business.

loans.use: charcoal

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adja a 49 ans et est veuve. Elle a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de condiments pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle a employé aussi une personne qui l’aide dans ses activités. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et compte dans cette activité près de 3 ans. Elle expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison à Bè adidomé à côté de l’église Notre Dame de Lomé. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Adja is a 49 year old widow. She cares for four children. She re-sells condiments in order to improve the condition of her life and the lives of her children. She also employs an additional person to help with her business. She purchases supplies for her business from the large market in Lomé and has been in this business for almost three years. She sells a variety of products behind her house in Bè Adidome, near Notre Dame of Lomé. She is requesting this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 5. 

Jocelyn is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest on the market. Jocelyn also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She works hard to be able to sustain her family. She hopes to have a stable business and income.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 41, is a strong mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her shoe-making business in the local community. Merlyn is thankful to ASHI for the loans it has provided since her membership, Merlyn has been able to support her business by purchasing required materials. She hopes to further improve her business in the future through hard work and the continued assistance of Kiva partner, ASHI.
Lack of business capital has encouraged Merlyn to ask for financial support from Kiva lenders. She will be glad if her loan request is granted and she will use the loan wisely to purchase needed supplies for her business. Her hard work and perseverance have laid the groundwork in bettering her life. Her long-term goal is to have her own shoe manufacturing shop someday. Merlyn hopes to maintain the long-term sustainability of her shoe-making business. She is very thankful that Kiva lenders through ASHI are able to share in the poverty alleviation program.

loans.use: To expand her shoe-making business

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito esta formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes son amigos, trabajan en diferentes actividades y cada quince días se reúnen saliendo así de su rutina diaria, son amables y cordiales, luchan cada día para mejorar su economía. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad cuna de grandes deportistas, poetas, la ciudad encierra la naturaleza, la arquitectura de lo colonial y lo moderno.

La Señorita. Susana Y. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito, vive por la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su segundo crédito y ha sido invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres exitosas.
Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 18 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, su papá es de profesión chofer y sus mamá es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señorita Susana se encuentra cursando el último año de los estudios del colegio y hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los que vende a sus compañeras en el colegio.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para continuar con su negocio. Su meta seguir una carrera universitaria.

La Señora. Mónica A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 19 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo que tiene 8 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como carpintero y viven en una casa que es de su propiedad.
Doña Mónica se dedica a trabajar como costurera, esta actividad la realiza hace un año, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este hermoso grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para iniciar en esta labor. Su sueño es  cursar los estudios universitarios y seguir la carrera de diseño grafico.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Mujeres de Éxito ("Successful Women"), is composed of 8 women and 2 male guest members.  They all work in different sectors, but every fifteen days they get together to break away from their daily routine.  They are friendly and cordial, and fight every day to improve their economic situation.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which is the birthplace of great athletes and poets.  It is a city surrounded by natural beauty and colonial and modern architecture.

Señorita Susana Y. is a member of this communal bank.  She lives in the Valle neighborhood.  This is her second credit and she was invited by her mother to become a part of this wonderful group of successful women.  She is a young woman of 18 years old.  She is single and lives at her parent's house.  Her father is a chauffeur and her mother is a business woman.  They do not own their home, but rent it.  She is currently finishing her last year of high school and has been selling cosmetics to her classmates for the past year.  She plans to invest her credit in the purchase of cosmetics in order to continue her business.  Her goal is to pursue a college degree.

Señora Mónica A. is another member of this communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca and is 19 years old.  She has an 8 month old son.  Her husband works as a carpenter and they live in a home that they own.  For over a year, she has worked as a seamstress.  She works Monday through Saturday from 7am to 6pm.  This is her first credit with the communal bank and was invited by her mother-in-law to become a part of this beautiful group.  She plans to invest the money from this credit in the purchase of clothing.  Her dream is to finish her university studies and major in graphic design.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor C. was born in 1971. She currently lives in Kompong Thom Province. Hor C. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. She has a life partner in her husband who earns a daily income by running a motor taxi in and around his community. They have three children, all of whom are single, and they also work with their mother in pig rising. 

Their existing motorbike which her husband uses to run his taxi service has recently broken down very often in the course of his motor taxi work. In order to support her husband’s business, Hor C. will use her loan funds to buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one. This loan will help her family achieve stability with their financial resource.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace their broken one

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Jesus; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de pollería y quinta restaurant, ella tiene estos dos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de pollería y quinta restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para su salud.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to "Hatun Rumiyoc" community bank, located in Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Maria Jesus; she is 38 years old and lives with her partner and 1-year old son. Maria Jesus has a poultry store and country-style restaurant. She uses the income from these small businesses to support her family and hopes to expand and improve them. 

Maria Jesus is requesting a loan for health reasons. She is happy to have the loan and is committed to repaying it.

loans.use: Health purposes.

loans.name: Glenda Elyzabeth

texts.es:
Glenda es una madre de familia muy activa al negocio, durante un periodo de siete años viene vendiendo ropa, cosméticos, prendas de plata, comenzando con pocos productos con un ahorro proveniente de su esposo quien es cadete de taxi.
Comienza a aumentar su inventario atreves de los financiamiento que Afodednic ha dado en siete ciclos, en donde ha logrado la captación de clientes, aumentaron sus ventas, adquirió la compra de vitrinas para tener más demanda al exhibir sus cosméticos. El cual vende al contado y al crédito.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: cosméticos variados, ropa escolar, zapatos y seguir rotando sus ventas como productos.
texts.en:
Glenda is a mother and very active in her business. Over a 7 year period she has sold clothes, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.  She began with only a few products with savings provided by her husband who is a taxi driver in training.  

She began to increase her inventory thanks to the loans that Afodednic has given her in 7 cycles, through which she has achieved a greater client base, increase her sales, and acquired glass cases to increase demand by exhibiting her cosmetics.  She sells on cash and credit.  

With this new loan she will buy: various cosmetics, school clothing, shoes, and continue rotating her products.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and various cosmetic products to increase sales

loans.name: Ethemie Christine

texts.fr:
cliente de 34ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 12ans à 17ans. en 1995 elle ouvre sa cabine téléphonique. 
avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des cartes a, warid, MTN et deux téléphones afin de renforcer son activité.
ses ambitions sont d'ouvrir une magasin de vente de téléphone, ouvrir une boutique d'habillement ainsi que voyager afin d'importer la marchandise.
elle souhaite encadrer sa famille dans le commerce, construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ethemie Christine O. is 34 years old, single, and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 17. In 1995, she opened her phone booth. With this loan, she intends to buy phone cards from operators Warid and MTN, as well as to phones, in order to bolster her business.

She ambitions to open her own phone store and a clothing boutique, as well as to travel to import products. She also wants to help her family in the business, and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maiya M. is 45 years old, married and has one child aged 24. In 2004, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW which she used to buy material for her tailoring business. Krishna Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material or sewing machines which will increase production and profitability.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas T. is a 35-year-old married woman who has been selling fresh fish in the busy market for many years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or at the river, which is full of fishermen. 

Mas T. is a single mother. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for years. 

Mas T. has an old motorbike that she always uses to transport her fresh fish to sell, but now it is broken. She will use her loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to transport her fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of drinks and top-up cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap, body cream, toothpaste, etc. to resell

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es una padre de familia de 36 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y turismo.

Lucio es agricultor desde hace algunos años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva limón,  este producto que cultiva es muy rentable,  ya que no necesita mucho tiempo para cosechar,  pero gracias a los ingresos que obtiene  puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y familia.

Por eso Lucio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo y mejore su producción de limón, así pueda seguir creciendo su negocio e incrementando sus ganacias.

Lucio es un hombre responsable y trabajador, todo el esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo es para que su familia tenga más comodidades y ofrecerles a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 36-year-old father living with his wife and children.  He has a house of his own that only has electricity located in the rural part of Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  All these places carry out farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Lucio has been a farmer for several years.  He has several hectares of land where he grows lemons.  This product he grows is very profitable because it doesn’t require a lot of time to harvest.  Thanks to the income he earns he’s able to meet household and family expenses.

Because of this Lucio has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan through its Seed Capital program to buy fertilizer for his fields to improve his lemon production so that he can continue growing in business and increasing his profits.

Lucio is a responsible, hard working man.  He puts all this effort into his work so that his family will have more comforts and to provide his children with other life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Venezuera Group

texts.en:
Aranyaeli is in his early 40s and married with four children who are still going to school.  He has a lorry which he is using for his transport business.  He gets tenders for delivering things like sand, small stones, roofing tiles and building materials.  He has been in this business for 5 years now.  He works from 6.00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a Bajaji (tricycle), paid school fees and household expenses.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to start poultry business.  His dream is to one day build another house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Venezuela" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To start a poultry business.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Emelie has operated a food shop where she sells rice and cassava cakes. 

Emelie is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional rice  to sell and ingredients for making and selling snacks like cassava cakes . In the future, Emelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice and ingredients for making cassava cake

loans.name: Darcho

texts.en:
Darcho comes from village Moliti, Borjomi District. He is 39 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children – three daughters (sixteen, fourteen and eleven years old) and his 3 -year-old son. Darcho’s wife Marine is a housewife. Darcho is the only income income in the family. 

He runs a family dairy farm, with three milk cows. With the milk Darcho produces approximately 90 kg of cheese per month. He sells it his small grocery store, located in the same village. Also Darcho’s family owns 0.3 hectare of agricultural land, where potatoes are grown. Harvested potatoes are also sold in his store. 

Along with cheese and potatoes, villagers can buy  different types of grocery products in Darcho’s store. In the spring/summer period Darcho had many agricultural expenses (tilling and fertilizing his plot, sowing potatoes). He didn’t have enough capital left to keep the assortment of the products in the store at a certain level. 

He requested credit to increase his existing stock in trade in his store, otherwise he will lose his customers and the family’s income will decrease.

loans.use: to purchase products to increase his stock in trade in the grocery store.

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, nuestra socia vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, son amables y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones ancestrales, se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio.

La Señora María tiene 70 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija que es mayor de edad, casada e independiente. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el fruto y sacrificio de varios años.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo y el sobrante lo vende. También cría cuyes, chanchos y ganado, la leche que obtiene es para la venta.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca.
 
Su meta es seguir adquiriendo animales para la cría.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Nueva Amistad” (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in Cumbe Parish.  This is a cold climate parish but its residents are warm hearted, kind and keep their culture and ancestral traditions alive.  They raise livestock, farm and are merchants.

María is 70 years old, married and has an adult, married, independent daughter.  Her husband’s a farmer.  The house they live in is their property; it is the fruit of the many years of sacrifice.

María is a farmer.  What she grows is for her own consumption and whatever is left over she sells.  She also raises guinea pigs, pigs and cattle.  The milk she obtains is sold.

She’s been in the communal bank for 15 years and she will use her new loan to buy a cow.  Her goal is to continue acquiring animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has been working in mixed farming in her hometown of Nyamira for the past three years. She produces and sells maize, bananas and milk which are all sold to the local market. She is married with six children who all attend school.

Teresa has made a loan request of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help her to educate her children and to purchase more land for better farming practices.

Teresa says scarcity of pesticides and costly farm fertilizer are a great threat to farmers

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Quennie

texts.en:
Quennie  is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 1 child. 

Quennie makes and sells snacks like rice & pan cakes. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Quennie  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Rafig

texts.ru: Rafig jenat i iemeyt 3 detey. Yemu 57 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Rafig 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Rafig is married and has three children.  He is 57 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children.  Rafig has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Afandemon

texts.fr:
Afandemon est  un homme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 4 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.  
Afandemon travaille comme revendeur depuis 1999. Il achète et revend pour ses clients composés de toutes personnes des appareils électroniques. Il travaille seule dans son commerce. 
Afandemon a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils electroniques. Il veut les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afandemon voudrait agrandir  l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afandemon, age 37, is married to a reseller. He has four children, out of whom two attend school. The oldest is 5 years old, the youngest is 2.

Afandemon has been working as a reseller since 1999. He buys electronic devices and resell them to a diverse clientele. He works alone in his business.

He is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy electronic devices. He wants to increase the profits of his business, which he would like to expand in the forthcoming years. He says that he intends to use his profits to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy electronic devices

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two sons, ages 6 and 16, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  Their ger is located in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, in an area without basic infrastructure. Both of her sons attend the local secondary school.

From 1994 to 2004, Odgerel operated an ice cream selling business.  Since 2009, she has been operating a grocery selling business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia.  She purchases her products from other wholesale suppliers. 

Autumn is very high shopping season in our country, so every entrepreneur such as Odgerel needs more products to sell. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase grocery products to sell in her small stall. Furthermore, she wishes to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Luis Gonzaga

texts.es: Luis tiene 73 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este medio de vida. Luis laboraba en el ingenio como carpintero fue con el paso del tiempo que el compro sus herramientas de trabajo y fue cuando dejo de trabajar en esa empresa que él se dedicó a trabajar en su taller en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen el trabajo que el realiza. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de madera, pega, clavos, maque, serruchos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Luis, age 73, provides carpentry services. He has been in business for more than 17 years. Luis worked at a refinery as a carpenter and was able to buy his tools over time. When he left this job, he decided to start in his own business where most of his customers are familiar with the work that he does.

Now he is requesting a loan in order to buy wood, glue, nails, lacquer, saws, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, nails, lacquer, saws, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán es un hombre de 71 años, que a pesar de su edad ha logrado muchas cosas en su vida una de ellas es tener su negocio que es una pulpería y ademas la venta de mercaderia en general, además tiene 15 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad. El inicio esta actividad con su esposa quien le ayudaba a realizar las tareas del hogar y además atender el negocio lamentablemente su esposa falleció, pero él siguió adelante con la actividad es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisolas, vestidos y trajes .
texts.en: Hernán is a 71 year-old man who, in spite of his age, has achieved many things in life. One of them is to have his business, which is a small grocery store where he also sells general merchandise. He also has 15 children, all of whom are grown-ups. He began this business with his wife, who helped him take care of the household tasks also tend to the business. Sadly, his wife passed away; however, he continued with the business. He is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, camisoles, dresses, and suits.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, camisoles, dresses and suits

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest son’s thread selling business. With the loan, he will purchase thread in bulk quantity, which will allow him to sell larger quantities and make more income.
  
Rani is the mother of 8 children. Only one of them is studying. Five of her children are involved in sewing businesses, and one operates a power loom with his parents. Her eldest son has been doing his business for the past many years, and Rani is hopeful that an investment will help him in improving his business and also increase his profits. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy thread for selling.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells cosmetics at Kokoado in Elmina, and she has been selling cosmetics for eight years. She is a widow and has five children. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Adjoa's loan will be used to buy more cosmetics. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a store for her cosmetics so that she can educate her children to the college level.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Lassina  est âgé de 48 ans marié et père de quatre enfants. Il est domicilié à Wayerma I à Sikasso dans une famille traditionnelle élargie.
Lassina après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant trois ans. Il dispose d’un magasin au grand marché de Sikasso en face de la BDM SA. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec il est à son cinquième prêt individuel , tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Il compte avec ce cinquième prêt  acheter,  25 sacs de maïs et 25 sacs de mil et 10 sacs de sorgho en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’êtres revendues en gros à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Mr. Lassina is 48 years old and married with four children. He lives in a traditional extended family in Wayerma I, Sikasso.

After attempting many unsuccessful activities, Lassina started three years ago a business trading and storing grain cereals (maize, millet, sorghum). He has a store at Sikasso's great market in front of the BDM SA.

In order to better serve his ever-increasing customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. He is now on his fifth individual loan, all previous loans having been properly reimbursed.

He intends to use this fifth loan to buy 25 bags of maize, 25 bags of millet and 10 bags of sorghum in the communities surrounding Sikasso. These goods are first stored in his shop to be resold wholesale to a client base of retailers and heads of households.

He expects this loan to generate a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA that will be used primarily to increase his business assets, contribute towards family expenses and pay interest on the loan.

loans.use: Buy grain

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 48-year-old divorced woman from Madaba, Amman.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 600 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Hanan is looking to have enough money to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from her pig fattening business. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ailyn  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero. Él  trabaja  como vendedor ambulante de productos de artesanía como ser hamacas, sabanas, frazadas, ya que una de sus hermanas trabaja en una empresa grande donde hay muchos empleados. Él  vende sus productos a los empleados y  cobra quincenalmente por los mismos. Tiene mucha aceptación entre los mismos debido a la facilidad de pago que proporciona a su clientela. Además se dedica también a la agricultura y la ganadería. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos, principalmente para fin de año. Agradece por la oportunidad que le están dando kiva y la fundación.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is 46 years old and single.  He works as a street vendor selling handcrafted products such as hammocks, sheets, and blankets, since one of his sisters works in a large company that has lots of employees.  He sells his products to the employees and collects payment from them every two weeks.  He has a lot of success with them because of the ease of payment he provides his customers.  He also works in agriculture and livestock.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets because he has lots of orders for these products, principally for the end of the year.

He is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva and the foundation are giving him.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años está casado con Juana, con ella tuvo a sus 8 hijos. Ahora solo vive con Beto de 12 años, que es el menor de todos. Martín tiene una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Carlos es un hombre ejemplar. Con su trabajo dedicado en la agricultura ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y brindarles una educación digna a sus hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja. Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra y negociar los productos que le otorga la naturaleza. En los montes de su comunidad cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en los que produce café.
Alfonso está contento con sus resultados, de las 3 parcelas obtiene como 15 sacos de café de 60 kilos cada uno aproximadamente.
A la vez, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados Brown Swiis.  “Compro terneras a 1200 soles y cuando las engordó las vendo a 2000 soles. Si es rentable.” Comenta. 
Carlos quiere ampliar su negocio de ganados pero sin descuidar sus cultivos. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Carlos obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionado por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se muestra esperanzado. De recibir el dinero, comprará bolsas de abonos para sus sembríos de café. Y con lo restante completará el dinero necesario para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58, and married to Juana. With her, he had his eight children. Now he only lives with Beto, 12, who is the youngest of all. Martin has his own house in the native community of Villa Maria Alto Yurinaki, in Chinchamayo province. 

Carlos is an exemplary man. With his dedicated work as a farmer, he has been able to raise his family, and provide a decent education for his children, whom he loves very much, and for whom he works.

He learned to work the land as a child, and sell the products that nature grants him. In the hills near his community, he has three parcels of cropland, where he produces coffee.

Carlos is happy about his results. From the three parcels, he gets around 15 sacks of coffee of approximately 60 kilos each. 

At the same time, he buys and sells Brown Swiss cattle. "I buy calves at 1200 soles, and when I have fattened them, I sell them for 2000 soles, so yes, it is profitable," he says. 

Carlos wants to expand his livestock business, but without neglecting his crops. This would be the first loan that Carlos that has obtained from MFP. He is excited about this. Now he is part of the "Los Productores Yaneshas" communal bank, which he has high hopes for. 

On receiving the money, he will buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee plantings. With what's left over, he will have the money he needs to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer, and materials for building his house.

loans.name: Leima Nupi Group

texts.en: Bidyarani is a 25 year old married woman. She lives with her family of 3 in Bishnupur district of Manipur state in the Eastern part of India. She is into the business of weaving and prepares towels, saris, loin wrappers, bed sheets, etc. She seeks a loan, which will help her to expand her weaving business by purchasing more raw material and to increase her production, which will eventually help her sell more final products. This loan will increase her monthly income by approximately Rs. 6,000. There are four other members in the group apart from the group leader. The other members of the group are also engaged in weaving businesses of their own. Similarly, the other members will use the loan to buy more stock and raw materials to expand their weaving businesses. Therefore, they all joined hands to form the group and applied for a loan for upgrading their businesses. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (different varieties of yarn) for her weaving business and sell towels, saris, bed sheets, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice U. is 38 years old, a mother of four (4) children, a dedicated LAPO client who cherishes her sales of ice cream to support her husband and her family. She desires the above amount to boast her icecream business.

loans.use: To buy ice cream and freezers for the store.

loans.name: Lomialagi

texts.en: Lomialagi S. is a promising businessperson.  She loves buying the best quality products to sell to her customers.   Lomialagi has no doubt about running her business, because she has the support of her family.  She started off with only a small retail shop, and now her business is being enlarged.  This is because the number of her customers and their needs have grown.   Lomialagi provides good service to her customers.  She also has the knowledge to help her customers with what they need.  She will use her loan to buy more wholesale goods to fill up her empty shelves, and to buy paint and wood to fix damages in her shop in order to encourage customers to come buy from her.  She believes that having this business is a very good chance for her to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.en:
Maria del Refugio is divorced and has three children, of whom, 2 are already married and the youngest is 22 and is still at college. The youngest helps her in her store in the afternoons when he is free and Maria also lives with one of her married children and her grandchild and helps provide for them all. Five years ago, she began her business and since then has been the head of the house. Little by little her business has grown and she is very happy with the progress. Maria is a hard working woman, she works in her store every day from Monday to Sunday and she does so willingly as she can see her business growing and can help her family.

Maria is asking for a loan of $475 in order to buy merchandise and to buy new products such as small gifts and stuffed animals. She proposes to repay the loan in 6-12 months and hopes that the support will help her to see her business to continue to grow and to obtain a better quality of life. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María del Refugio esta divorciada y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales 2 ya están casados y el menor tiene 22 años y está en la universidad, este último la ayuda en su negocio por las tardes cuando tiene libre y además ella vive con uno de sus hijos casados y su nieto y ve por ambos económicamente. Hace cinco años empezó con su negocio rentando un lugar en el centro de la ciudad y desde entonces ella ve por su familia, poco a poco su negocio ha ido progresando y esta muy contenta con ello, María es una mujer muy trabajadora, atiende su negocio todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo y lo hace con mucho gusto por que esta creciendo y así ayuda a su familia.

María del Refugio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para la compra de mercancía y compra de nuevos productos como regalos y no solo mantenerse en peluches, ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses y espera que la apoyes a seguir creciendo con su negocio y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga C. has a great love for animals. From the time she was very young, she had pets that she raised in her parent’s house. Unfortunately, her family’s lack of economic resources forced her sell and give away her pets to help out with expenses.

Olga is the mother of three children less than 8 years old, she is divorced, and living in her parent’s house. She is the owner of a small pet shop in the July 16 market. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in a place to raise pure-bred pets, which would allow her to provide for her three children, to be able to give them the necessary education, and to meet their basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga C. tiene una gran afición y amor hacia los animales, desde muy pequeña tuvo mascotas que criaba en casa de sus padres. Lastimosamente la falta de recursos económicos la obligo a vender y regalar sus mascotas para la subsistencia diaria. Madre de tres hijos, menores de 8 años, divorciada, viviendo en casa de sus padres, Olga es dueña de un puesto de venta de mascotas en la Feria 16 de Julio. Con el préstamo que solicita, piensa invertir en un criadero de mascotas de raza, que le permita salir adelante con sus tres hijos y así poder brindarles la educación necesaria y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.

loans.use: To invest in a place where she can raise pure-bred pets.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu has been a very trustworthy business partner. She has received 3 loans from Mekong Plus and has repaid each loan on time. The last loan she received was funded by Kiva. Thu sells porridge and noodle soup from her home. Her business has really improved since she's partnered with Mekong Plus. She used to receive loans from other sources which charged high interest rates, but now she is able to keep all of the profits from her sales. She earns about 20,000 VND per day ($1.25).

With her profits, she has been able to fix holes in her house to prevent it from collapsing, and she was able to buy cement to build a small water well. She wishes to receive another loan in order to help her microbusiness expand.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for porridge and noodle soup stand

loans.name: Delia María

texts.es:
Delia is a courageous woman who, after a slip in her life and becoming pregnant, and facing the irresponsibility of her partner, has been able to succeed by selling kitchen articles, then spare parts, and nowadays imitation jewelry. Every so often, Delia travels to Lima to buy wholesale the most exclusive designs in jewelry, so she can then sell them retail in different places in her city, offering them to people who walk on the streets. In this way she has been supporting her daughter, who is the light of her life and her reason of being.

She always works to give the best to her little girl and this is why she works very hard to cover the costs of her education with the goal of preparing her to face life. Delia works constantly and would like to be able to set a stand where she can offer her products more formally.

She is asking for a loan of US $375 to greater quantities and variety of merchandise with the goal of taking advantage of Christmas sales.

She is committed to return this money in a responsible way and thanks those people who decide to support her in solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Delia es una mujer valiente que tras un desliz en su vida al salir embarazada y ante la irresponsabilidad de su pareja, ha podido salir adelante con la venta de diversos artículos de cocina luego de repuestos y en la actualidad de bisutería.Cada cierto tiempo Delia viaja a Lima para comprar al por mayor los más exclusivos diseños de bisutería que pueda encontrar para luego venderlas al por menor en diferentes lugares de su ciudad ofreciéndolas de manera ambulante a las personas que transitan por las calles de esa manera hace 5 años sostiene a su hija que es la luz de su vida y la razón de su existir. Siempre trabaja para darle lo mejor a su pequeñita y es por ello que labora diligentemente para cubrir los costos de su educación con el objetivo de verla mejor preparada para enfrentar a la vida. Delia trabaja constantemente y desea poder establecerse en un stand para hacerlo de manera más formal.

Solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares para comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería a fin de aprovechar la campaña navideña.

Así mismo se compromete a devolverlos responsablemente y agradece a aquellas personas que solidariamente decidan apoyarla.

loans.use: Buying merchandise and setting up sales stand.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat trades electronics at the store. She lives with her mother who is ill and needs constant care. She started her business 5 years ago when her father died. Before that, she was working as a sales clerk at the store. Her dream is to increase her capital and purchase a trading spot instead of renting it. Most of her profit she uses for medication for her mother.

loans.use: Trade of electronics

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old. He is married and has 4 children, three of whom are studying in school. He lives in a rented house. He has a small restaurant. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new cooking stove, tables and chairs, renovate the restaurant, hire two unemployed helpers, and do some advertising for the restaurant to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new cooking stove with tables and chairs

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.es:
Ever since her husband lost his job, Arcelia started to look for a way to earn money to cover the household expenses. Her friend then suggested that she sell shoes by catalogue, which Arcelia thought was a good idea. This is why she started to sell these products 1 year ago, and little by little she has gained popularity in her residential area.

Fortunately, Arcelia counts on a considerable list of customers, which is of great benefit to her. Moreover, her husband was finally able to get a job. Nevertheless, she currently does not have enough resources to be able to buy the merchandise that her customers are requesting, given that she sells her products in installments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this loan, Arcelia will be able to buy the merchandise she needs to be able to fill her customer’s orders; therefore she will not risk losing those customers that she has been able to keep thus far through many efforts. With your support, Arcelia will be able to move her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que el esposo de Arcelia se quedó sin trabajo, ella comenzó a buscar otra manera de poder sacar dinero para tener para pagar los gastos de su casa. En una ocasión una amiga de ella le recomendó vender zapatos por catálogo, lo cual a Arcelia le pareció muy buena idea. Fue así como hace 1 año que comenzó a vender estos productos y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia.

Afortunadamente Arcelia cuenta actualmente con una lista considerable de clientes. Lo cual le ayuda mucho, además de que su esposo ya consiguió trabajo. Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando sus clientes, puesto que ella les vende a ellos a plazos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Arcelia podrá comprar la mercancía necesaria para poder surtir los pedidos que le hicieron y así no perder los clientes que con mucho esfuerzo a podido mantenerlos con ella. Con tu ayuda Arcelia podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Teresia's Sauti Group

texts.en:
Teresia, 33 years old, is divorced with 2 children, ages 17 and 14. Teresia sells clothes, a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $525 to purchase more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending and cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia’s two daughters, ages 16 and 12, are the reason that she undertakes more and more businesses. 17 years ago she began working in a shoe store in a market in her district. In the mornings she works there and beginning two years ago, in the afternoons she has worked in the general store that she opened in her home. Happily it is doing well, but nonetheless she wants to keep making progress and shortly she will open another store at a stall in another market. She is planning on hiring someone for this store who will help her attend to customers, as her daughters are still in school and her husband works at a transportation business. For now she wants to give her businesses stability, and in the future she would like to be a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Las dos hijas de Dionicia con 16 y 12 años son el motivo que la lleva a emprender cada vez más negocios. Hace diecisiete años empezó trabajando en una zapatería dentro de un mercado de su distrito. Por las mañanas trabaja ahí y por las tardes, desde hace dos años, trabaja atendiendo en una bodega que abrió en su casa. Felizmente le va muy bien, no obstante ella quiere seguir progresando y dentro de poco abrirá también un bazar en un puesto dentro de otro mercado. Para esto ella piensa contratar un personal que a ayude en la atención, pues sus hijas aun estudian y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de transportes. Por ahora ella quiere darle estabilidad a sus negocios, de todo modos dentro de un tiempo le gustaría ser mayorista.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her new store

loans.name: El Buen Futuro ( A Good Future) Group

texts.en:
Silverina lives with her two children and husband in a small rural town in the Dominican Republic.  She runs a small business selling new and used clothes from her home, and occasionally she sells her merchandise on the streets of her community.  She also sells gasoline by the gallon to her community members -- people often buy gasoline in smaller quantities here because  it is so expensive -- which is a profitable business.

She is requesting a loan to buy a better selection of clothes to sell, and a to buy a larger quantity of gasoline.  It is her goal to own her own store where she can sell a variety of clothes, and operate a real gas station.

She hopes her children will continue studying and that within a few years she will have saved enough to buy their own home.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Silverina herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the improvement of her used and new clothing business

loans.name: Hai Seminary Marikolong 2044-6 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fibi K.. She sells posho (a cornmeal based starch) and beans, and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Fibi is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging from ages 6 to 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Fibi makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

Fibi is joined in her small group by Makala O., Baronica K., Voulate E., and Lona J.. Makala O. sells bread and wants to buy an oven. Baronica K. sells vegetable and wants a loan to pay school fees. Voulate E. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Lona J. sells bread and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Juana Claudia

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Communal Development Bank.

Juana is married, 57 years old and has 9 children. She lives in a small house with her children. She travels to different markets in the region to buy grains, which she later sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells candy as a ambulantory vendor as well as makes cotton candy, which she makes with sugar and food coloring.

Juana needs a loan for 1,200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat and barley.

Juana´s dreams are to improve her businesses and to have more money.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Juana es casada, tiene 57 años y 9 hijos, Vive en una quinta junto a sus hijos, viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales que posteriormente venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además venD. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria, caminando, también elabora un dulce llamado algodón que esta elaborado con azúcar y colorante.

Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. maíz, trigo, cebada.

Los sueños D. Juana son mejorar sus negocios, tener mas capital.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
In the city of Yaguaron, 15Km. away from the Paraguari office, a group of women who wanted to start entrepreneurial activities got together and increased their working capital in order to improve their quality of life and their families, so they contacted us to learn about the program, they accepted the opportunity offered by this institution.

The committee’s name is El Manantial, they are currently on the first cycle, with great qualifications, formed by 16 entrepreneurial and active women. These women have invested each on their respective activities, they are learning and valuing the importance of forming a committee because of the opportunities that they get , to grow as people and improve their quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 15 Km. De la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, de ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por la oportunidad que se les está ofreciendo ya que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho.

El comité lleva por nombre El Manantial, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 16 emprendedoras y activas mujeres. Estas mujeres han invertido cada una en sus respectivas actividades, quienes están aprendiendo y valorando la importancia de conformar un comité por las oportunidades que se les presenta para crecer como persona y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Your loan will be invested on each one of their activities, like buying meat, beverages, bread, oil, pasta, rice, flour, milk, clothes, bed sheets, medicine, fruits and vegetables and groceries items, etc. / Sus créditos han invertido cada una en sus respectivas actividades, como son la compra de carne, bebidas, panificados, aceite, fideo, arroz, harina, lácteos, zapillas, cacerolas, ropas, sábanas, remedios, frutas y verduras en general, accesorios de mercería, ect.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 3 years old. She sells juice and is a hairdresser and she has been painting since 2002. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 260 from her sales.

Munawar is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh is 28 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. This young man has run this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a cow to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijas.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en lo que hace, su gran responsabilidad, como sostén único de su hogar, la han llevado a tomar la decisión de  tener un negocio propio donde pueda generarse los recursos económicos, es así, que en su tienda ofrece productos de pan llevar y la atención que ofrece es diaria, en su localidad, la demanda de sus productos es durante la mañana, por las tardes se dedica a ver a sus animales, Pilar quiere continuar con este negocio, porque le permite sostener a sus hijas, además que se siente contenta por ser independiente.  El motivo de su esfuerzo son sus hijas. Pilar solicita ese préstamo que le será de mucha utilidad para incrementar la mercadería de su tienda, ella es muy perseverante y su meta es tener una tienda bien surtida en productos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 30 years old and lives with her two daughters. She is a hard-working woman in everything she does and her great responsibility, as sole support for the household, led her to make the decision to start her own business to earn a living. It’s for this reason that, in her store, she offers many basic needs products and tends to her customers on a daily basis. The demand for her products is during the mornings, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to caring for her animals. Pilar wants to continue with this business because it allows her to support her children, and because she feels content being independent. The motivation for all her efforts is her daughters. Pilar requests this loan which will be very useful to her to increment the merchandise in her store. She is very perservering and her goal is to have a well-stocked store.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Roy Eduardo

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Roy M., tengo un taller de estructuras metalicas en donde fabrico puertas, marcos, ventanas, portones etc. en estos momentos tengo varios proyectos pero son grandes y me falta un poco de capital para comprar material y asi cubrir con todo lo especificado, por tal razon estoy solicitando el credito. de mi dependen mi familia que es lo mas importante en mi vida.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Roy M.. I have a workshop for metal structures where I make doors, frames, windows, gates, etc. Currently I have various projects, but they are large and I need a little capital to purchase materials and, in this way, meet all the specifications. For this reason I am requesting a loan. I support my family, which is the most important thing in my life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 35 años, es soltera, vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de hoja de coca, para su uso en diferentes momentos, como  medicinal, para dárselo a los turistas contra el soroche y mareo, para que la gente lo adquiera para realizar el conocido pago a la tierra, entre otras costumbres de la región. La venta es buena, ya que este tipo de eventos son muy realizados en la cosmovisión andina, lo más difícil de su venta es tener que comprarla, ya que siempre se presentan inconvenientes por sus otros nexos ilegales. Este es 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de hojas de coca para venderlas en este mes de diciembre, ya que por estas fechas se realizan los pagos a la tierra.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 35 years old, single, and lives alone in a house left to her by her parents. She sells coca leaves which are used in a variety of ways: medicinal, selling to tourists as a remedy against altitude and motion sickness, to people who buy it to do tribute to the earth among other customs of the region. Sales are good as these types of events are very common in the Andean beliefs, and the most difficult part of the sales is having to buy the leaves, as they can be difficult to find because of their other illegal uses. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy a large quantity of coca leaves to sell during the month of December, as during this time of year people make tributes to the earth.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of coca leaf to sell

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de Dieu B. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean de Dieu is 26 years old, married with 2 children.

This entrepreneur has been a motorbike driver for three years but what is amazing is that he got his own motorbike. This man gets up very early at 5am every day to start transporting people to their workplaces. Jean de Dieu is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf, which will help him to buy another motorbike. He will be paying back this loan over 8 months. His goal is to send all his siblings to school and build a house for his family.

loans.use: buying another motorbike to transport passengers

loans.name: Chheut

texts.en: Chheut S., 28, lives with his wife in Battambang, Cambodia. He has run a motor-taxi business since 2006 and is able to make $5 per day, while his wife, pictured here, makes $4 a day by selling fruit from home. This loan will be used to invest in the fruit business.

loans.use: To invest in fruit business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 50, sells fruits and vegetables in the Kampong Cham Province. She has two employed children who work as construction workers. Her husband, 60, is blind and stays at home. Mrs. Chea S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This will reduce transportation costs that she spends every day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hồng năm nay 46 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu nhưng  đến nay gia đình chị đang đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng ăn và sản xuất đồ gỗ cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại địa phương. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu  chính của gia đình chị với thu nhập  4.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ  một phần chị dùng để đầu tư cho cửa hàng ăn, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thêm gỗ về đóng bàn ghế bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi H., 46 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Initially, she borrowed money to invest in scrap materials collection, but currently her family invests in running a food stall and making furniture to supply to the consumers in the area.
