These are the business that bring the main source of income for her family, which is VND 4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000. She will use one part to invest more in the food stall, and the remaining part to buy wood to make tables and chairs to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in the food stall, buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Lov

texts.en:
Mrs. Lov N., 33, married to Mr. Sim, a taxi driver, has one teenage child enrolled in the local public school. Lov sells traditional Khmer cakes, purchasing her ingredients from the market, making the cakes in her home and selling them to her neighbors. 

Currently reliant upon taxis, Lov is hoping to reduce her transportation costs by requesting a loan to buy a second-hand motorbike and increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorbike.

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Маруфчон - молодой человек 28 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена домохозяйка. Делает домашние дела, нянчит за ребенком. Днем дома скота нет, потому, что Маруфчон отгоняет их на пастбище. И только вечером пригоняет их обратно. Недавно домашнее хозяйство у Маруфчона стало отдельным. Отец отделил его домашнее хозяйство и передал ему небольшое количество скота. Прежде Маруфчон брал займ для увеличения количества скота общей семьи. Но теперь за этот новый займ он хочет пополнить свой скот.
texts.en:
Marufjon, 28, is married and has 2 children. He is a cattle farmer. Marufjon's wife is a house maker taking care of the house and the children. During the day, the cattle is out in the fields. Recently, Marufjon separated from his father's household. Marufjon's father provided him with a house and some cattle. In the past, Marufjon took loans to purchase cattle for his whole family, but now he will be buying cattle for himself.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Asha I. from Mwanza. She is single with one child who is 8 years old. Asha has been running a cosmetics business since 2008. Her business is to sell cosmetics and women shoes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Asha currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase cosmetics and shoes for women. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asha thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and shoes for women.

loans.name: Neder

texts.es: Neder tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Creció en una familia de agricultores realizando las tareas del campo, y ahora es el brazo derecho de sus padres que ya son ancianos, por lo que actualmente es el sostén de su casa. Neder se encarga del cuidado de cada uno de sus cultivos para que sus productos sean bien cotizados al momento de su comercialización; asimismo poseen vacas, por las que él también vela para que produzcan abundante leche y de buena calidad, que a su vez vende. Con estas actividades, es que Neder genera los recursos económicos para su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y por lo tanto, ser parte de un banco comunal es una nueva experiencia para él, pero desde que comenzó, ha hecho votos de ser responsable con sus pagos y con las actividades encomendadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita será para la compra de fertilizantes y medicinas para sus tierras de cultivo, y debido a que el costo es mayor, Neder cubrirá el monto faltante con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Neder is 23 years old and lives with his parents. He grew up in an agricultural family, working the fields. He is now his parents’ right hand because they are elderly, which means that he is the breadwinner of the household. Neder is in charge of taking care of each one of his crops so that they can be sold at a good price. They also own cows that he looks after so that they can produce abundant amounts of good quality milk for him to sell. With these two jobs, Neder earns a living for his family. This is his first loan with MFP. As such, being part of a microfinance institute is a new experience for him, but since he joined, he has vowed to be responsible with his payments and with the activities entrusted in him by his credit consultant. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and other products for his crop fields. Because these are expensive things, Neder will have to pay for the rest of the costs with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and other products for crop fields

loans.name: Ahmad Samer Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Samer is the leader of the Ahmad Samer group. There are six members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. They want to take out a group loan to develop their separate businesses, and to bring about some changes and improvements.

Ahamd Samer wants a loan for his general store; he would like to increase the size of his shop. M. Rahem wants a loan for his tailoring shop. Deba wants a loan for her husband’s photo shop. Palwasha wants a loan for her tailoring business; she hopes to enlarge her shop. A. Rawof wants a loan for his business as a taxi driver. Ahmad Shafeq wants a loan for his ice cream shop.

They would like to say that this loan process is a good one which can support all entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 72 años 06 hijos, que ya no dependen D. ella y tienen sus familias.Se inicio con la venta D. queso; hace muchos años atrás, nos cuenta que se iniciaron con S/. 500.00 y trabajaban con pedidos D. sus clientes, ahora se encuentra mas establecida, ya que cuentan con un fundo donD. crían sus ganados vacunos y a diario extraen leche para la preparación D. los quesos que los  prepara en su misma casa.  Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos como: cuajos D. leche, limón en kilos, sal y algunos moldes para sus quesos. Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante y brindarle una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Dora belongs to the Banco Comunal "Siempre Unidas", Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. She 72 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom no longer depend on her and have famillies of their own. She began selling cheese many years ago, starting with 500.00 soles and working only when she received orders from customers. Today, she is more established, working together with a ranch where they raise cattle. The cattle are milked every day so that she may prepare her cheeses, which she makes in her own home. With this loan of 500.00 soles, she will invest in the purchase of supplies such as rennet, kilos of lemon, salt, and various molds for her cheeses. She is very satisfied with the work that she does. Even though it is difficult, she believes that her work is worth the sacrifice in order to fulfill the dreams and goals she has laid out for herself over the course of her life. She gives thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering help both to her and to other women who want to improve their lives and achieve peace and happiness as their lives advance into old-age.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos, para elaborar sus quesos

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe M. reside en Olocuilta en el departamento de La Paz. Morena tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos niños Balmore de 10 años y Emerson de 5 años de edad. Morena posee una pupuseria en la zona de Olocuilta la cual es muy conocida por todos los extranjeros ya que siempre los llevamos a comer nuestro platillo típico, ya que Olocuilta se encuentra situado en la carretera que conduce hacia al aeropuerto de El Salvador, es allí donde los salvadoreños con sus negocios ofrecen variedad de platillos típicos y en su mayoría son las pupusas, es así como Morena y la tradición de las pupusas en El Salvador la han llevado a tener  ya treinta cinco años en su negocio y ahora solicita un crédito porque  desea invertir en su negocio, en la compra de materia prima para las pupusas y así seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe M. lives in Olocuilta in the La Paz region. Morena is 45 years old and a single mother of two children, Balmore, aged 10, and Emerson, aged 5.
Morena owns a pupuseria in Olocuilta, which is well-known among foreigners since we always take them there to eat our traditional food. Olocuilta is located on the road to El Salvador’s airport, and is where Salvadorans run businesses offering a variety of typical dishes and mostly pupusas. This is how El Salvador’s pupusa tradition has already given Morena 35 years of business.
She is now requesting a loan to purchase pupusa ingredients for her business and, in this way, continue to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil soltera, y es madre de 02 hijos, y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en Barrio San Antonio.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de venta de condimentos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pimienta, comino, ajis, ajos, orégano, etc. Rufina también vende comida en su pequeño restaurante.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio y llevar a otros departamentos inclusive.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Rufina belongs to the Santa Cruz de Bellavista Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 42, single, and she has two children. She completed the second year of high school. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her initial loan was for 500 PEN, which she used as capital for her business of selling condiments. She now needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy pepper, cumin, chilies, garlic, and oregano, etc. Rufina also sells food in her small restaurant. Her greatest wish is to improve her business and take it to other departments as well. She likes the savings and the meetings (of her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pepper, cumin, chilies, garlic, and oregano, etc.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Adelfa is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Adelfa has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Adelfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: La señora Soledad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años, 04 hijos, ya independientes.Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco, hace varios años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/. 500.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies, para vender su producto se traslada por diferentes zonas, sus clientes ya la conocen y están muy satisfechas con su producto.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará pescados frescos en sacos, tanto lo que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Soledad belongs to the Las Dinámicas II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department. She is 53 and in a common law marriage. She has four children who are now independent. Several years ago she started selling fresh fish in order to help her family with income. She started with 500 PEN, which was very well invested. Now she continues in the same business, but in larger quantities and varieties of fish. She travels to different regions to sell her product. Her customers now know her and are very satisfied with her product. With this loan for 3,000 she will buy sacks of fresh regional fish as well as fish from the coast of the country. She will buy fish like bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey to keep her business stocked and to satisfy the taste of her discerning customers. She is pleased to have belonged for so many years to a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties, which she now confronts with more strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fresh fish

loans.name: Sosorburam

texts.en: Sosorburam D. lives with her two grandchildren in Uvukhangai province in central Mongolia. They all live together in her ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. She provides for both of her grandchildren, including paying tuition for her grandson. He currently attends a university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. D. operates a cosmetic trading business in her town. She sells a variety of cosmetic products that are imported from China, Korea and Japan. Her children live and work in Japan and help deliver some of the products to her. D. started her cosmetic trading business in 2007 by renting a stall at the local market. She travels once or twice a month to Ulaanbaatar  to purchase products to sell. For the future, D. hopes to grow her business further so she can continue to provide for her grandson's education. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is 57 years of age and she is still single, she doesn't want to get married because of poverty, she's with her mother and father and their age is already in the level of 95 years old above, and then she decided to have a business particularly in vegetable vending. They are currently residing at Culing Centro, a rural and plain area,500 meters away from the national highway of Cabatuan. Her vegetable plantation is at the back of their house. 
Her weekly net income is PHP 1,000.00, her source of income is vegetable farming and vending. She struggles for the sake of her family, and sacrifices all what she have, for her father and mother. She applied a loan amount of PHP 6,000.00 for her additional capital. She hopes that KIVA will grant her loan immediately, to support her mother and father.

loans.use: Addtional capital in her vegetable vending

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio S. is a fisherman. He is 58 years old and has nine children with his wife Fidelita. He plans to buy an engine for his boat so he can expand his fishing business. He applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php 8,000 so he can grow his business.

loans.use: Buy boat engine.

loans.name: Oping

texts.en: Oping I. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 52 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Oping owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling fruit in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Oping joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Die

texts.fr: Madame Die F. est une commerçante qui s'est convertie en avicultrice suite à une longue maladie .ce prêt entre dans le cadre du renforcement de son activité pour mieux gérer son temps en élevant des poussins destinés à la revente .Ainsi elle pourra générer des revenus pour faire face aux dépenses de sa famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Die F. is a businesswoman who became a poultry farmer after a long disease. This loan will bolster her activity and enable her to manage her time more efficiently when she raises and sells her chicks. Thus she will be able to generate some income to meet her family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en: Olubunmi, 35 and married with a child, sells jewelery such as rings, bracelets and necklaces; she also sells clothes, including sarongs. Operating this business for over seven years now, she is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase clothes and jewelry in bulk to get a better price. Olubunmi hopes that this loan will help make her business more profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Odily Del Socorro

texts.en:
Odily del Socorro sells watches, underwear, and personal products in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. She is asking for a loan to purchase watches to expand her inventory. She has been working in the market for about 11 years. Before she had her stall in the market, she sold her products “ambulante,” which means while walking around.

Odily del Socorro is married and has two children in her care. Both of her children are school aged. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4½ years. In this time, she said, loans have helped her increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy watches

loans.name: Hayfaa

texts.en:
Hayfaa is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Hayfaa has owned a grocery store since 1980. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products etc…She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Hayfaa has been a micro credit client for 10 years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise and offering more products. 
Hayfaa is speciA. in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and passers-by. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty since she always had her family’s support. Hayfaa decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income and she always wanted to work for herself. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour y avoir accédé à 10 fois de suite. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, de l'oignons, de la pomme de terre etc. Elle a comme objectif de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Martine D. is a married, 47 year-old woman without children. She has been a member of the Sainte ANNE1 Village Bank for the past 5 years and has been able to repay 10 consecutive loans. She owns a shop where various products such as rice, oil, sugar, onions, potatoes, etc are sold. Her goal is to increase her savings and help with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carry out her business actvities

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado V. H., tiene 60 años de edad, está soltero, y vive con su hijo de 11 años. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar insumos como el abono, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que siempre se le han brindado. Don Amado tiene una hectárea y media sembrada de café y desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo los estudios, una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Amado V. H. is 60 years old and single. He lives with his 11 year old son. He wants the loan to help with his farm. Specifically, it is for his coffee crop. His plan is to buy supplies like natural fertilizer, chemical fertilizer, and herbicides to give his coffee crop adequate maintenance. This way he will obtain a better quality and get greater income at harvest time. This is not his first loan with Fudescosur. He is very happy with the services they have always given him. Amado has one and a half hectares of coffee planted. He has been a farmer for several years. In the future he hopes to give his son an education, a better quality of life, and greater economic stability. He hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with coffee crop

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina G. is from the village of Cabungaan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Rizalina owns and operates a business offering motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 16,600 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be her 24th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali sont essentiellement des femmes mariées    qui ont en moyenne 40 ans,  3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de wax, de poissons, de savons,  de chaussures et de pomme de terre.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter,  5 pièces de pagnes wax real, 2 paniers de poissons fumés, 5 cartons de savons (gros morceaux), 4 douzaines de paire de chaussures  en plastique et  3 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent  à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are essentially married women who average 40 years of age and three children living for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their first loan.  The group members sell wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fish, soaps, shoes, and potatoes.  With their loan, they intend to buy:  five bolts of Real wax pagnes, two baskets of smoked fish, five boxes of soap (large bars), four dozen pairs of plastic footwear, and three 100-kg sacks of potatoes.  Supplies are gotten at the big market of Sikasso City and in neighboring villages.  Sales are made out of the house, in the markets, and door-to-door in the districts.  Cash and sometimes credit are accepted from a customer base composed of men and women.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other portion will be invested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group Creciendo Juntos (growing together).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. Margarita's group is located in El Seibo, a rural, agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Margarita is excited to be taking her fifth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling clothing.  She intends to travel to the capital to purchase a dozen skirts, pants, blouses and underwear in the main market and then selling them in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing a stove and school supplies for her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Capital to buy wash basins wholesale and to sell them

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 64 years old, married with 7 children. He has a farm where he plants cassava; during harvest he sells the cassava to sellers. With the profits from his farm, he meets the basic needs of his family. He wants to grow his business. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava stem to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stem to plant

loans.name: Dustmurod

texts.en:
O. Dustmurod is married and has one small child. Dustmurod is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about eight years. During that time he has become very popular at the market and has many clients. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let his customers know the benefits of his products – he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is now with his venture. Dustmurod is seeking a loan of 6,000 TJS to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Dustmurod’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Santa María està integrado por dos socias, Rosa Etelvina G. y Betulia Etelvina G. H., ambas son familiares.  Las dos socias viven en la Colonia Santa María en Juticalpa, Olancho.  Antes habia otra socia pero se atrasaba en el pago de sus cuotas.  

Sra. Rosa Etelvina G. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 7 hijos.  Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo.  Empezó su negocio con una chiclera pero la ganancia era poca y decidió cambiar de negocio a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.  Invertirá el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras en materia prima como maíz y leña para aumentar su producción de tortillas y sus ganancias.  Con las ganancias podrá mejorar la alimentación y educación de su familia.  La Sra. Rosa Etelvina G. sueña con poder ampliar su casa y hacerle unas mejoras porque está bastante deteriorada.  Ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente.  Agradece la confianza y el apoyo brindado por FAMA, ya que a traves de los préstamos ha superado momentos difíciles.    

Sra. Betulia Etelvina G. H. tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo.  Con su hijo tiene un negocio de reparación y servicio de computadoras.  También se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y la venta de agua purificada.  Con el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras comprará componentes de computadoras, ropa de segunda mano y agua purificada.  Con el apoyo del préstamo su negocio será más amplio y sus ganancias aumentarán.  El sueño de Sra. Betulia Etelvina G. es que su hijo siga su educación en la universidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa María” is composed of two members, Rosa Etelvina G. and Betulia Etelvina G. H.. They are family members. They live in the Santa María neighborhood of Juticalpa, Olancho. There used to be another member, but she got behind in making her repayments. Rosa Etelvina G. is 44 years old. She is a single mother and has 7 children. She has been making and selling tortillas for a long time. She started her business with a street stand selling sweets, but the earnings from it weren’t much, so she decided to change the business to making and selling tortillas. She will invest her loan of HNL 3,000.00 (Honduran Lempiras) in raw materials such as corn and firewood so she can increase her production of tortillas and her income. With the earnings she could improve her family’s food and education. Rosa Etelvina G. dreams of being able to expand her house and make some improvements to it because it is quite deteriorated. She has been a good client of FAMA and has always paid punctually. She is grateful for the trust and support shown to her by FAMA because the loans have helped her through difficult moments. Betulia Etelvina G. H. is 64 years old. She is a widow and has one son. Along with her son she has a business repairing and servicing computers. She also sells second-hand clothing and purified water. With the support of the loan, her business will grow and her earnings will increase. Betulia Etelvina G.’ dream is for her son to continue his education at university.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy tiene 41 años, comparte su vida en compañía de su esposo Basilio y de sus hijos Larry de 18 años y Sara de 9 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 8 años se dedica en la atención de su bodega, negocio del cual también instaló bazar y librería, de ese modo su negocio es el más concurrido por los vecinos de la zona en la que vive, pues ofrece gran variedad de productos. Elsy se siente felíz porque cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y de su esposo, quienes constantemente están arreglando los mostradores y atendiendo a la clientela. En un futuro desea ampliar su tienda, así como abastecerse de diversos productos, con el fin de complacer con la necesidad de sus clientes. su mayor anhelo es dar bienestar a su familia y salir adelante. Este es su diecinueveavo crédito con MFP y en todos sus años de trabajo siempre ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería para las próximas fiestas patrias.
texts.en:
Elsy, 41, shares her life with her husband, Basilio, and her son, Larry, 18, and her daughter, Sara, 9. They live in their own home. For over 8 years she has tended to her grocery store where she also sells general merchandise and stationery items. This has led to her store being the most popular among her neighbors in the area where she lives because she offers a wide variety of items. Elsy is happy because she can count on help from her husband and family who are constantly arranging the display cases and providing customer care. In the future, she’d like to expand her store as well as stock up on more diverse items in order to meet her customers’ needs. Her greatest wish is to provide wellbeing for her family and to get ahead. This is her 19th loan with MFP; she has shown much responsibility in all the years she has collaborated with us. She will use the requested funds to buy merchandise for the approaching national holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Hajii

texts.en:
Hajii L. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. He is 32 years old. Hajii is single. Hajii owns & operates a a sari-sari (variety) shop where he sells food & daily use products. Hajii has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Hajii joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Hajii is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Hajii from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Azucenas Dobles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Las Azucenas Dobles” que están ubicadas en Lerma, este grupo se conforma por 11 integrantes, donde se encuentra la señora Senorina G. H. mejor conocida como “Doña Seno”, se dedica  a la venta de servilletas y manteles bordados, nos cuenta la señora Seno que a ella le enseñó su Mama a Bordar desde muy pequeña es por ello que decidió seguir este Arte del bordado, la señora Seno es Madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que son su orgullo y los que la impulsan para salir adelante y poder darles una carrera profesional y que puedan tener una vida mas cómoda. La señora Seno destina su crédito para poder comprar hilos y telas y así realizar más bordados y venderlos entre sus vecinos y algunos clientes que tiene.

En este mismo grupo se encuentra la Señora Teresa V. Q. quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios para automóviles, ella pide el crédito para invertir en material para su negocio, la señora tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y casados, uno de ellos está en la universidad y el más pequeño cursa el segundo año de secundaria, la señora Teresa nos cuenta que el principal motivo de invertir y hacer crecer su negocio, es el poder seguir apoyando los estudios de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
Teresa G. B.

TESORERA:    
Martha B. Q.

INTEGRANTES: 
Alicia S. C.
Maribel P. N.
Benita Q. J.
Sonia B. Q.
Luisa B. H.
Edith H. C.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Azucenas Dobles" and is located in Lerma. The group is made up of 11 members, one of whom is Senorina G. H., better known as "Doña Seno". She sells embroidered napkins and tablecloths. Seno says that her mother taught her to embroider when she was very young, and this is the reason that she decided to continue with this art. Seno is a single mother and has three children who are her pride and who drive her to succeed and to be able to make them professionals with a more comfortable life. Seno's loan will be used to purchase threads and fabrics to make more embroidery to sell to her neighbours and some customers. In this same group is Miss Teresa V. Q. who sells accessories for automobiles. She is requesting a loan to invest in material for her business. She has four children, two of whom are grown and married, one of whom is in university and the youngest of whom is in the second year of high school. Teresa tells us that her main incentive to invest and grow her business is to be able to continue to support her children's studies. The other group members are: President: Teresa G. B. Treasurer: Martha B. Q. Members: Alicia S. C. Maribel P. N. Benita Q. J. Sonia B. Q. Luisa B. H. Edith H. C.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in material for their businesses

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 43 years old and is married with eight children. He owns a grinding machine that he uses for grinding cassava, sorghum and some other agriculture products. The hours of his business are from morning hours until late in the evening.

Jean, after realizing that the number of his customers has increased, wants to open another business area where he will operate the same business. To end this, he is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase an additional grinding machine.

With this additional machine, Jean hopes that he will be able to satisfy his customers and, in addition to that, earn a lot of profits. These profits will hopefully allow him to continue taking care of his family and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To buy another grinding machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old and married with five 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn operates a business venture selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cajina lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Blanca Almendares quien inicio  vendiendo esquimo. En la actualidad comercializa de ropa, negocio en el que invertirá el crédito  y con el cual tiene la meta poner una pequeña tienda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Lidia M. Dávila quien comercializa reposterías, chocobananos y helados que ella misma elabora mientras Ana Virginia P. Martínez tiene una pequeña fritanga.
texts.en:
The group Cajina is made up of three hard-working women. One of these women is Blanca Almendares who started out selling Eskimo products. Currently, she sells clothing. She will use the loan to invest in this business. Her goal is to have her own small store. The other members of the group are María Lidia M. Dávila, who sells pastries, chocolate covered bananas and ice cream that she makes herself, and Ana Virginia P. Martínez who runs a small restaurant that makes authentic, home cooked, Nicaraguan foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Sochet

texts.en:
Mr Sochet C. (pictured above) is 28 years old and his wife, Mrs Da Vorn, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have just one daughter who attends school. He also has an elderly mother who lives with him. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sochet is a security guard and drives a motor taxi in his free time. His wife is a garment factory worker. He wants to change his taxi business from a motor taxi to a Tuk Tuk (motorized rickshaw) because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkan sont toutes  mariées. Leur moyenne d’âge  se situe autour de 38 ans et elles ont en moyenne 7 enfants. Les femmes du groupe Benkan vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des voisinage et  des liens de parenté. 
Elles excellent dans l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et diverses petites marchandises. 
Assa MORIKE T. qui est la présidente du groupe est une vendeuse de riz au grand marché de SAN, qui compte acheter 3 tonnes de riz. Elle s’approvisionne avec les producteurs de la ville et revend en détail et au comptant. Cette activité est très rentable pour elle.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 29000 FCFA tandis que les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice 27000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement  du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkan group are all married. They average 38 years of age and seven  children each. They live in large traditional families in the city of San (in the Ségou region of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors and relatives.

They excel in the buying and selling food condiments and various small goods. 

Assa MORIKE T., president of the group, sells rice at the big market of San. She plans to buy three tons of rice. She gets her stocks from local rice growers and sells at retail, for cash. This is a very profitable business for her.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 29,000 FCFA, while other members expect to make 27,000 FCFA each month, to be used to repay the loan and cover family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Algela Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Aquí encontramos  a la señora Angela, ella tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos dos ya son mayores e independientes, sus tres hijos menores viven  con ella los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo, ya son varios años que lleva con ella y dice que su tienda es su vida ya que en ella además de ganarse un dinero extra para el sustento de su familia también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para  su tienda. Nos cuenta que estuvo en el Banco pero se retiro y regreso hace dos ciclos, le gusta por las facilidades que brinda tanto para conseguir los créditos como también para  pagar las cuotas. Su sueño es tener salud que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

We find Ángela, 42, here.  She is married and has five children.  Two are adult and independent and the three younger children, who are in school, live with her.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She has a small grocery store that’s open daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that her store is small but stocks everything.  She’s been in business for several years now and she says that her store is her life because besides earning extra money for her family’s support there it’s also where she enjoys the company of her friends who come by.  She buys her merchandise in Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for the store.  She tells us that she used to be in the communal bank but dropped out.  She returned to it two years ago and likes it because of the ease with which loans are obtained as well as the easy payment plans.  Her dream is to be in good health which is the most important thing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
This is Lily D., 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Victor D., a seafarer. They have three children enrolled in elementary school. At this time, both of them are working hard to continually provide income for their children’s education and for everyday expenses.

Lily operates a ready-to-wear items business and a general merchandise store where she mostly sells groceries, toiletries and beverages. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lily dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more  products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Aboudou Nassirou

texts.fr: Nassirou a 34 ans  et père de 3 enfants. Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu, la vente de produits d’alimentations générale et cumule près de 3 ans dans cette  activité. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de hédzranawoe et revend à côté de Fossi Sono. Il sollicite ce prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Nassirou is 34 years old with 3 children.  To earn money to take care of his children, he has been selling food products for the last 3 years.  He buys his stock in the Hédzranawoé market and re-sells it in nearby Fossi Sono.  He is requesting this loan to buy more stock.

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Samuel Githinji

texts.en:
Samuel   has been in the mining business for the last six years in Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 42 years old and married to Rachel Wangui. They are blessed with four schooling children.

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to pay to lease land and cater for the labour.

In future, Samuel hopes to expand his business outside Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To pay to lease land and cater for the labour

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame T. is married and has eight dependants. Her husband is a farmer.  She has studied up to a Senior High School level. Maame sells plantain and fresh pepper at Abura.  Maame uses her income to assist her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Maame will use the loan to purchase other types of food to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase new types of food to sell.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Kandal Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seang V. was selected as leader by the other members. Each member will use her portion of the loan for a different purpose to improve her family's living standards.

Mrs. Seang V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows leeks. She doesn’t have enough money to support her farming, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate the leeks. Her husband, Mr. Thuon Thet, 33 years old, works as an iron welder in a company, earning a small salary to support the family. This couple has three children; one attends a local school and the others, 5 and 3 years old, are not yet in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cultivating leeks

loans.name: Benkadi  (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants. Ce groupe Benkadi fait l’achat et la vente, d’habillements, de condiments, de fruits et légumes et du sucre.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles ont leur troisième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Djeneba T. qui est un des membres du groupe Benkadi fait l’achat et la vente des condiments de toutes sortes (huile, oignon, Sounbala, tomates, cubes magies, ail, épices etc.) Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au marché de Hamdallaye.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA chacune au cours de ce cycle, Djeneba T. elle, compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles envisagent utiliser une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: Benkadi is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala City who live together in that district in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and co-wives. The group members average 36 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children. The group buys and sells clothing, condiments, fruit and vegetables, and sugar. To expand their businesses, the group members decided two years ago to joint the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their third group loan. And the previous ones have been repaid properly. Djeneba T., who is a member of the group Benkadi, buys and sells condiments of all kinds, such as oil, onions, sounbala (pounded and fermented seeds or beans), tomatoes, Maggie bouillon cubes, garlic, spices, etc. She is in high demand because she occupies a good spot at the Hamdallaye market. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments. She acquires her merchandise wholesale at the big market of Koutiala and sells retail, accepting cash from a customer base comprised essentially of women. While the other group members plan on making an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA over the course of each cycle, Djeneba T. plans on making 120,000 francs. In addition to making loan payments, the group members envision using a portion of the revenues for coping with common family expenses.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Joseline Patricia

texts.es:
Joseline, tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres, está soltera, residen en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosmético y ropa.
Ella fundo este negocio hace 5 años, su madre la apoyo para iniciarlo ya que tiene experiencia en el negocio, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm, por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para  comprar mercadería, cosméticos, cremas, lociones y ropa para el negocio, esta inversión le ayudara muchísimo, pues Joseline no quiere descuidar su negocio y piensa contar con el por un largo tiempo, ya que de acá logra tener sus propios ingresos.
El objetivo primordial de Joseline es tener un negocio rentable, capaz de atender las exigencias de los clientes, además cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Joseline is 25 years old, and she lives with her parents.  She is single, and she lives in the San Miguel department of San Miguel.  She buys and sells cosmetics and clothes.

She founded this business five years ago.  Her mother helped her start it because her mother has experience in the business.  She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  She is now requesting a loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, creams, and lotions.  She will also buy clothes for her business.  This investment will help her a great deal.

Joseline does not want to neglect her business.  She plans on having it for a long time.  The business is where she manages to get her own income.

Joseline’s prime objective is to have a profitable business that is capable of taking care of her customers’ demands and covers the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, lotions, and clothes for her business

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita Tiene 20 años, vive en casa de unos familiares con su hijo pequeño. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en las ferias ganaderas de su zona, uno de sus familiares la ayuda en esta tarea ya que siempre es necesario trasladar sus animales al puesto de venta. Ella consigue los animales a un menor precio, de esa manera garantiza su margen de ganancias, que le servirá para los gastos de la semana, durante este tiempo ha visto que sus ganancias le son rentables por lo que desea aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sarita is 20 years old.  She lives in a family member's home with her young child.  For more than 6 months, Sarita has been buying and selling animals in livestock markets in her area.  One of her family members helps her in her work since it is always necessary to transport her animals to her sales location.  She acquires her animals at a lower price and, in this way, she guarantees her profit margin which helps her cover her weekly expenses.  

Over the time she has been in this business, Sarita has seen that it is profitable and so she would like to increase her working capital.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those who will help fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying more animals wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more small animals

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres  Oñondivepa  se conformó el  20 de agosto del año 2010, mediante  la iniciativa de la Sra. Delis Anatolia B., quien supo del programa y decidió juntar a las señoras de su barrio pues tiene ganas de salir adelante, después de unas cuantas reuniones grupales se juntó a 13 señoras.
Actualmente están en el 2do ciclo del préstamo con mucho esfuerzo y esmero,y lo lograron sólo porque han trabajado en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa "Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras".
La Sra. Delis Anatolia se dedica a la venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito y la asesoría recibida pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración. Ella se encontraba vendiendo ropas pero con el dinero que recibió pudo ampliar su negocio y mediante esto la economía de la familia mejoró bastante.
Hoy día solicita el crédito para poder comprar comestibles para su tienda, ya que en Paraguay uno de los negocios con mayor éxito son las tiendas de comestibles, pero sólo si se cuenta con inmensa cantidad de variedades, pues los clientes son exigentes.
Espera poder contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya como en el ciclo anterior.
texts.en:
The Mujeres  Oñondivepa Committees was formed on August 20, 2010, thanks to the initiative of Delis Anatolia B., who decided to bring together the women of her neighborhood to help them get ahead.  After a few meetings and a lot of effort and care, the group garnered 13 women.  It is now on its second loan cycle.  The group works collectively and individually.

Delis Anatolia sells clothes.  She says that because of the credit and advice she has received from the microfinance partner, she has been able to significantly improve her work and her management skills.  She has used the money to increase the size of her business and, as a result, her family's income has increased considerably.
She is asking for the loan to buy groceries for her store, since one of the most successful types of business in Paraguay are grocery stores. They are only successful of they have a wide amount of variety, because the clients are very demanding. She hopes to count on the support of Kiva lenders and Fundacion Paraguaya just as she did in her previous loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food (rice, sugar, herbs, milk products, pastries, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita J. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Rosita is married and has 3 school-aged children. Rosita owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads, detergents, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong T. T.  N. is 37 years old and has two children. 

She is managing a shop that sells aquatic products such as snails, crabs and fish. Her business has been opened for six years since she received a loan in 2005. Her business is quiet good. It provides a profit of 3,000,000 VND that is very useful to her in managing her family life. 

She is an enthusiastic client of our program and has helped us to increase the number of  new clients in her village. 

This year, she wants to have a loan of 8,938,000 VND to purchase an oxygen pumping machine for the fish.

loans.use: to purchase an oxygen pumping machine for fish

loans.name: Robinson Raymundo

texts.es: Robinson tiene 40 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Paijan, unas dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 3 años, se dedica a trabajar como maestro albañil. Su hijo mayor lo apoya en esta actividad. Actualmente su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea mejorar su vivienda y reconstruir algunas partes de ella. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Robinson es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Robinson is 40 years old.  He lives with his wife and their 4 children in a rural area of Paijan district, 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  For more than 3 years, he has been working as a master bricklayer.  His oldest son helps him with this work.  At this time, his house is in a deteriorated state.  He wants to improve his house and rebuild some parts of it. To do this he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Robinson is a very hardworking and responsible person.  He has good references from his neighbors and others who know him.  He thanks the Kiva lenders for helping him to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to rebuild parts of his house to reinforce it and better protect his family

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling cooking oil. She is a 46 years old widow. All of her 8 children go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand her business, in the future, with the extra profits from this business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 13, 11 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos, la socia vende papa. Maíz, cebada, trigo, habas, moraya, chuño. La socia tiene un pequeño stand en el mercado y la socia compra al por mayor productos y los hace secar para la venta de productos en este género, la socia desea poder comprar al por mayor maíz en todos los tipos y en forma de granos poder venderlos ahora que comenzará la nueva etapa de siembra de maíz, La socia suele tener clientes que tienen terrenos agrícolas y buscan semillas para la siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos de maíz para la venta.

 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” community bank.  She lives in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 13 and 11.  Her business is buying and selling dried products.  She sells potato, corn, barley, wheat, beans, 'moraya' (washed frozen potatoes) and chuño (frozen potatoes).  She has a small stand in the market where she sells her products wholesale.  She dries her products before she sells them.

The borrower would like to buy all kinds of corn wholesale, in kernel form.  She will then sell them now that the new corn-growing season is starting.  The borrower's customers own their own farmland and are looking for seeds to sow.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying corn kernels to sell.

The borrower appreciates this loan and is infinitely grateful for it since it will allow her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying corn kernels to sell

loans.name: Asuncion Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama la "Asuncion" esta ubicado en el estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes, entre ellas se encuentra la señora Mayola originaria de la localidad. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 18 años, tiene 3 hijos (dos hombres y una mujer) vende lenceria desde hace cinco años, decidio iniciar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir algunos gastos de la casa ya que los ingresos son bajos, su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos tengan un mejor calidad de vida y terminen una carrera universitaria por esta razón busca alternativas de trabajo para poder darles una mejor vida, con el prestamo que le otorguen lo utilizará para surtir mejor su mercancia ya que así tiene la oportunidad de comprar en cantidades mayores y con un mejor precio logrando tener más ganancias para el crecimiento de su negocio y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Asuncion group is located in the state of Mexico.  The group is comprised of nine members.  Mayola is a member who is a originally from the area.  She is 35 years old, and she has been married for 18 years.  She has three children (two boys and a girl).  She has been selling lingerie for five years.  She decided to start her business in order to help her husband cover some household expenses because his income is low.

Her greatest desire is for her children to have a better quality of life and that they finish their university studies.  That is the reason she looks for work alternatives in order to be able to give them a better life.

She will use the loan that she gets to better stock her merchandise.  That way she has the opportunity to buy larger quantities for a better price.  Then she will get more income in order for her business to grow and for the quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for her business.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada works hard to support her family. Iluminada is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Iluminada has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall.

Iluminada has been in this business for 20 years .

In the future, Iluminada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Shamin

texts.ru: Shamin 37 let . On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Shamin i yego semya jivut v Baku regione. On uje 7 let kak uchitel po muzike, on uchit detey igrat na raznix muzikalnix instrumentax. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye muzikalniye instrumenti chtobi uchit detey. Shamin sam ochen lubit muziku i starayetsya chtobi deti polubili muziku tak je kak i on igrali ot vsey dushi.
texts.en: Shamin is 37 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Shamin and his family live in the Baku region. He has been a music teacher for seven years.  He teaches children to play different musical instruments.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy new musical instruments to teach children.  Shamin loves music very much and tries to teach children to love it as well, and to play with all their hearts.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Flor Victoria

texts.es:
Flor es una madre de familia de 35 años, vive en casa de unos familiares junto con su hijo, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de alta actividad comercial, turismo y en los sitios aledaños agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace 2 años Flor se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza , confección y venta de prendas de vestir, su negocio lo tiene en el interior de las Galerías llamada la Feria Balta en la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza  como de tela para seguir elaborando prendas de vestir innovadoras para exhibir y vender a su clientela y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Flor es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Flor is a 35 year old wife and mother. She lives in a relative's house with her son. The house has all of the basic services and is located in an urban area of the Chiclayo province. The area has high commercial activity and tourism. In the surrounding areas there is farming and cattle.  

For 2 years, Flor has sold beauty products and she has made and sold clothing. She has her business inside the galleries of a place called Feria Balta in the city of Chiclayo. She has her own clientele. With the income she obtains she will be able to offer a better  lifestyle to her son.  

She has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products as well as fabric to continue making innovative clothing to show and sell to her customers. This way she will be able to obtain more earnings to have a better quality of life. Flor is a hardworking woman and a mother who always tries to get her family ahead despite the problems that sometimes come up in life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products as well as fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 47, is married and has five children. Her husband helps her in managing her general store and in taking care of their children or family as a whole. She sells everyday products in the store situated near their town in Isabella province. 

Her husband purchases goods to sell twice a week in a "tricycle", going to the wholesale grocery store. Her observed average daily net income is as low as P 300 and is used to save for future use and loan amortizations every week.  

Edna is asking for a loan of P 19,000 to purchase drinks, spices, snack foods and vegetable oil to sell in the store.  She carefully and responsibly does her task to grow as an entrepreneur and a borrower at the same time to improve whatever business she may have someday.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, spices, snack foods and vegetable oil to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 50 and has two daughters. Her husband works as a bricklayer.  

Thuy has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past three years. She sells a variety of goods, such as sugar, confectionery, soft drinks and basic household necessities. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of basic goods, foods and beverages to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy confectionery, food, beverages and basic household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aljon

texts.en:
Aljon is a 19-year-old man living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is a single man who runs a transport business for a living. He has been driving his two-wheeled vehicle to transport passengers to and from designated destinations.   Aljon gets PHP 3,000 a month from services offered.  In his single status, he enjoys meeting many girls or individuals and befriending them sometimes.   

Earlier this year, Ajon joined Gata Daku MPC to access financial services. He is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair the tires for his motor vehicle and to buy other accessories. Maintaining the vehicle in good running condition will help him pursue and cover his daily needs. 

Aljon plans to further improve the appearance of his vehicle to attract more passengers to ride on it and expand sitting capacity to earn more income.

loans.use: repair his motorbike and buy accessories

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old and the single mother of a 24-year-old.  She has been able to raise up her child with the income she gets from her boutique.  She also earns extra income from her dairy farming.  She has retained her boutique for eight years because of financial support from Faulu Kenya.  

Margaret hopes to expand her boutique for more income generation.  She has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
