While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health and medicinal products to tourists and local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth C., 35, has been involved in a business of selling very popular Cambodian noodles at a tourist place in Seim Reap Province near Tonle Sap Lake with a typical income of US $20 per day. C. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family.

C. and her husband are blessed with four school-aged children. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who usually earns an income of US $5 per day. He provides his transportation services to local people in his town and tourists as well. However, C. really wants to take a loan of US $200 for her husband to operate another business of buying fish from the fishermen at the lake and transporting them to sell at the local markets to make a plan for repairing her house feasible.

loans.use: buying fish and transporting to market

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Ms. Pisey C., age 30, is single and lives with her parents on an Island of the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three brothers, one of whom is a construction worker, and two sisters. One of her sisters has full-time employment and the other one weaves silk at home.

Pisey has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Pisey is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her sister to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to use to drive to work

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: La dame Aby D. est âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle tient un étal ou elle vend des fruits de saison. Les revenus générés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aby D. is a lady who is 61 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She has a stall where she sells seasonal fruit. The revenues generated enable her to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit in season

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren L. owns a 2-hectare rice field that he tills because it is his only source of income for his family. Now that his family needs more support for food, clothing and other basic needs, the income that he makes from growing rice is not enough. He is skillful in raising hogs, so he was encouraged to start a small piggery to supplement their income. 

In August 2008 he heard that CEV offers low interest rate, which is quite interesting and beneficial for business starts. So he decided to be a member of a cluster organization and used his 1st loan for hog supplements and also for some financing needs. 

Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 10,000.00 so he could buy feed for his hogs.

loans.use: Hog Feed

loans.name: James

texts.en: James W. has been making furniture in Naivasha town for the last eleven years. He is 50 years old and married to Pauline Wanjiku and they have two school-going children. James heard about KADET through the marketing promotions done by the company staff. This will be his second loan with the organization and he plans to buy more timber as material for his business. He paid off his first loan well and he used that money to buy new tools for his trade to replace the older ones. James intends to continue growing the size of his workshop and to employ someone who will help him in carpentry as his production and number of orders increase. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more timber for his business

loans.name: Toeng

texts.en: Toeng S., aged 51, is a married woman blessed with five children. Four of them are married and have already started new homes, while the other one is single and employed in the garment industry. She sells a variety of cakes, which her husband produces, in front of a factory for garment workers. After Toeng S. finishes selling, she goes to buy her essential ingredients at the market for her husband to make more cakes. Her sales are going well because her customers recognize the good quality of her cakes. To make her business more successful, Toeng S. is looking for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her business

loans.name: David Onyango

texts.en:
David Onyango is 27 years old. He operates a general retail shop in Manyatta, a low-cost settlement area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. He has been in this business for the last three years. 

This is David's third loan from KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner. He will use these funds to purchase more stock for his shop and to diversify into a number of items that he has not stocked before, like dairy products.

He aspires to purchase a plot of land and develop it, with an ultimate aim to move the business there.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock for his general retail shop, including dairy products

loans.name: On Time Traders Group

texts.en:
This is the On-Time Traders Group. They are small-scale businesspeople who live and work in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT for the first time for a loan of Le 500,000 so that they can expand their businesses. This loan will allow them to buy more items to sell, generate more sales and earn more profits. This will, in turn, mean a better standard of living, including more clothing, food and education for their children. 

Adama Fornah (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Matotoka village, about eight miles from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is now about 45 years old and is married to a businessman. They have five children – one in secondary school, one in primary school and the others not yet old enough to attend classes. She makes a living selling cakes, rice and groundnuts, and has been in this line of work for many years.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies that can be made into cakes and snacks to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana, married with a grown daughter, lives in Nikopol and sells women’s suits and knitted wear. She owns two vending locations at different city markets. Her merchandise always sells well because of the lower price policy she has set in her kiosks. She has a loyal clientele, some whom even come from other cities to buy from her. A hard worker who usually works late hours, Tatyana has been in the trade for 10 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnyas. Monthly net profit is usually about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Tatyana, always very committed to her family, tries to provide the best for her daughter, a college student. She is now requesting a loan of 13,000 Grivnyas to buy assorted merchandise for her vending locations to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Zagdhuu

texts.en:
Zagdhuu L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Two of her sons currently attend university and her only daughter is a secondary school student. L. and her husband operate a small grocery shop in their town, selling a variety of Mongolian and imported food products. L. started her business in 1999, at first selling only baked goods which she made at home. After having success with her baked goods she saved enough money to rent a small workroom which she now owns. L. is planning to expand her business in the near future and hopes to make a wider variety of baked goods. She is focused on supporting her children and says, “I need to save for my children's education.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and equipment for her business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Wara Group

texts.es:
“Wara” un grupo unido y alegre de 8 integrantes que pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, así, Lidia H. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Maria Elena M. y como Secretaria de Actas es  Rossi M., las tres organizan a sus compañeras para llevar adelante su reunión, además de elaborar el reglamento interno.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de comercialización, es decir, compra y venta de productos, producción y servicio y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para sus familias, además a ellas les gusta el consultorio porque tienen la oportunidad de cuidar su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
“Wara” is a close-knit, happy group made up of 8 members who belong to the “Centro Focal Collpani.” Lidia H. is president, Maria Elena M. is treasurer, and Rossi M. is the secretary. The three women organize their colleagues to carry out their meetings and establish internal rules. Each woman has a different business in buying and selling products, production, and service. They need this loan to invest in their businesses and generate income for their families. They also like the doctor's office because they have the opportunity to take care of their health and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise and Raw Materials

loans.name: Lavodi Plus Group

texts.en:
Lavodi Plus is a community bank of twenty-nine owners of small businesses. It is chaired by Franck O.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Franck, 31, became a micro-entrepreneur in 2007 and runs a booth selling phone accessories. Currently he earns a profit of $25 a day. His dream is to open a boutique in his area.

Franck has already received four loans from HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. He intends to use this loan to reinforce his working capital in order to purchase more phone accessories to sell.

Franck is married and has two children, 6 and 8 years old. Both go to school.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Émilie S. est une femme de 48 ans, mariée est et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de Sainte ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et a été 10 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait de l'abattage et vente de viande de porc. Elle compte également acheter des chaises et de les mettre en location. Elle contribue à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emilie S. is a 48 year old woman, married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the "banc Villageois" of Saint ANNE for the past 5 years and was granted 10 loans. Her activity consists in the slaughter and sale of pork. She also plans on buying chairs in order to rent them. She contributes to improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre de 52 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su hija de 15 años de edad.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ceviche (platillo tradicional peruano, elaborado en base a pescado y limón). Ella tiene un puesto afuera de su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para la preparación de esta comida, pues se requiere de varias manos que corten los limones y  piquen las cebollas, que es la labor más molesta. Sin embargo, ya se ha acostumbrado a trabajar con rapidez, pues sus clientes son muy exigentes y debe despachar a la mayor cantidad de porciones para generarse buenos ingresos.
Para el futuro, Delia ambiciona instalar un restaurante y está realizando algunas mejoras en su casa para implementarlo allí, por lo que necesita mejorar sus ganancias para poder ahorrar y hacer su sueño realidad.


Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con esta institución, ya que sabe que no tendrá inconvenientes con los pagos gracias a su gran responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos muebles, utensilios de cocina e ingredientes para el ceviche.
texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 52 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her 15 year old daughter.

For the past two years, Delia has been selling ceviche (a traditional Peruvian dish prepared with a base of fish and citrus juice). Her vending stand is located outside of her house and she has the help of her daughter in preparing this dish. Many hands are required to slice the lemons and chop the onions, which are the most time-consuming tasks. However, Delia is already accustomed to working quickly because her customers are very demanding and she must sell a large number of servings in order to generate a good income. Delia hopes to open a restaurant in her home sometime in the future, so she is already making improvements. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can save enough money to make her dream a reality.

This is her first loan with MFP. Delia is happy to be working with the Institution and knows that she not have any problems with her payments as long as she works responsibly. The money she requested will be used to buy furniture, cooking utensils, and ingredients for making ceviche.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture, cooking utensils, and ingredients

loans.name: Ganiyat

texts.en:
Ganiyat lives in Oyo, Nigeria.  She is 32 years old and married to a civil servant.  They are blessed with two children, ages 4 and 2, and she hopes to give them a quality education.  

Ganiyat sells groceries and drinks to her customers. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. 

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Felicia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Felicia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Felicia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azucar y arroz.
Los sueños de Felicia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y terminar sus estudios de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Felicia is a member of the San Benito Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Felicia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, meat, and vegetables. She manages her store every day.

Felicia needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of milk, sugar, and rice. She dreams of improving her business, finishing her studies in accounting, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she stays with two people. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Christine takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family. Christine owns a stall in Owino market, selling second hand clothing. She works six days a week. Christine receives at least 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Christine has been in this business for two years and her business challenges include the rainy season, because she works from an open place, and seasonality. Christine has been with MCDT for six months, servicing her second loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes for resale. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start buying bales of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van C., 35, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. She produces Cambodian traditional cakes (usually cooked in bamboo) for a gross income of about USD 20 per day. Her husband is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Wofugan

texts.en: Wofugan C. is a small entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a food shop at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells various food crop products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil and soaps. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops at the city market center at Kariakoo and directly from the food crop suppliers wholesale. Business income helps him to meet daily family needs and capitalize the business. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale

loans.name: Dembe Womens Group, Jinja

texts.en:
41-year-old K. Medi has been a taxi driver for an amazing twenty-three years. This married father of seven school-going children has been relying on the remuneration from this trade to bring food to his family’s table.

In the Jinja taxi park area where Medi has been operating from for all these years, his reputation and track record are never in question. By all accounts, he is a man with a friendly line of conduct, going by the way he associates with his fellow drivers.

Medi began as an apprentice taxi conductor, bidding his time slowly till he learnt how to drive and eventually become a driver. His desire to learn is part of the reason why he has seen such business longevity. Every month, he says he makes close to 240,000 shillings as profits.

With this loan, Medi says he wants to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es:
“LIBERTADORES”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades D. comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 8 meses.
Zenobia asume el cargo D. presidenta, a sus 41 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 7 y 14 años D. edad, quienes se encuentran en el colegio.
DesD. hace 13 años se dedica a L. venta D. salchipapas, el cual lleva por nombre “SALCHIPAPAS ZENOBIA”, se inicio en este negocio porque trabajo en un restaurante como azafata, luego 	quedo embarazada y perdió a su bebé, fue entonces que su esposo le dijo que se independizara y puso su pequeño negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado mejorar su casa y apoyara en L. educación D. sus hijos, sus ingresos cubren el pago D. sus cuotas y servicios, poner un negocio en su vivienda es el gran sueño D. Zenobia,  el reciente préstamo será destinado a L. compra D. una carpa, sillas y mesas para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado D. los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Libertadores” (Liberators) is a communal bank composed of 10 passionate and combative members, whose chosen business activity is similar (they are all retailers), and who have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 8 months Zenobia is the president. She is 41 years old, she is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 14 who go to school. Thirteen years ago she started selling salchipapas (sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries), known as “Salchipapas Zenobia”. Before she started this business she used to work in a restaurant as waitress; then she got pregnant but lost her baby, so her husband encouraged her to gain independence and to open her small shop. With the effort of her daily work she has succeeded in improving her house and in helping educating her two children, as her income covers the expenses of their enrollment fees and educational services. Zenobia’s big dream is to set a shop in her own house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an awning, chairs and tables for her shop. All of our members are thankful for the support granted by the investors and they all commit to paying within the specified periods.

Translated from Spanish by EmanueL. VilL., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an awning, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 32 años, es madre de 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 13 años, la segunda 6 años y el último 8 meses, se dedica a la elaboración de panes, Ana lo elabora en la panadería de sus padres, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde que tenia 10 años de edad.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Ana lo va ha invertir en la compra de harina, huevo, levadura, mantequilla, manteca, aceite y azúcar.
La dificultad que tiene en su negocio es la competencia, pero se siente contenta porque eso le impulsa  a mejorar la calidad de sus panes.
El sueño de Ana es poder tener su propia panadería en su casa, pero para ello necesita más capital por eso esta ahorrando y se siente muy contenta por que su dinero se esta incrementando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco." She is 32 years old and is the mother of 3 children: the oldest is 13, the middle child is 6, and the youngest is 8 months old. She has a business making bread. Ana makes bread in her parents bakery. She learned this trade from her parents from the time that she was 10 years old. Ana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of flour, eggs, yeast, butter, lard, cooking oil and sugar. The main difficulty she faces in her business is the competition, but she feels content because this motivates her to improve the quality of her bread. Ana dreams of having her own bakery in her home, but to do this she needs more capital, and she is saving up for this. She is pleased because her savings are growing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, yeast, butter, and other supplies to make bread

loans.name: Altyngul's Group

texts.ru:
Заработать на хлеб насущный и прокормить семью – долг и обязанность каждого человека. Порой эта задача кажется нам чем – то непосильным, требующим неимоверных усилий делом. Однако если понаблюдать за людьми, окружающими нас в повседневной жизни, мы сразу же заметим, что это не такая уж и трудная задача. Всё что требуется человеку, чтобы начать зарабатывать – это прежде всего желание работать. Герои нашей истории хотят работать и трудиться во благо своих семей. Алтынгуль Мамбетова – лидер данной группы. Алтынгуль вместе с семьёй проживает в г. Карабалта. Ей двадцать девять лет. У Алтынгуль двое детей, каждому из которых по восемь и по шесть лет соответственно. Чтобы прокормить семью муж Алтынгуль работает на рынке. Алтынгуль также работает на рынке. Она занимается розничной торговлей детских игрушек. Алтынгуль уверенно ведёт свою бойкую торговлю. Ещё бы, ведь она постоянно ощущает, что рядом с ней муж, который в свободное время всегда рядом с ней и всячески ей помогает. У Алтынгуль стабильный заработок: около десяти тысяч семисот сомов ежемесячно. А ведь семь лет назад, когда они только начинали свой бизнес, всё это выглядело довольно хрупким предприятием. Тогда они получили кредит и вложили около пятнадцати тысяч сомов и купили товар. За последние годы, благодаря начатому делу, им удалось купить дом и обставить его новой мебелью. Алтынгуль обратилась за этим кредитом, так как хочет купить товар в целях увеличения ассортимента. В её дальнейшие планы также входит купить автомашину, отремонтировать дом и купить корову. 
Партнёры Алтынгуль:
Розе Токтоболотовой 35 лет. Она мать троих детей. Все её дети ходят в школу. Муж Розы работает на стройке, а сама Роза занимается торговлей. Роза надеется получить этот кредит и закупить на него товар. 
Бактыгуль Усупбаевой 37 лет. Муж Бактыгуль – пенсионер, а Бактыгуль работает на виноводочном заводе. Всесте они воспитывают двоих детей. Бактыгуль нужен кредит для того, чтобы купить мягкую мебель. 
Мире Мендекеевой 42 года. Мира имеет троих детей и чтобы прокормить семью приходится работать и ей и мужу. Муж занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Мира в свою очередь торгует продовольственными товарами. Она обратилась за этим кредитом, так как  хочет купить товар для увеличения товарооборота. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Earning a living and feeding a family is a debt and responsibility of every person. Sometimes this task seems to us as something unattainable, a task, requiring unbelievable efforts. However, if we observe people surrounding us in our daily lives, we notice right away that it is not such a difficult task. All that a person needs in order to start earning is, before all else, a will to work. The heroes of our story want to work hard and work for the benefit of their families. Altyngul M. is the leader of this group. Altyngul and her family lives in the city of Karabalta. She is twenty-nine years old and has two children, who are eight and six years old. In order to support the family, Altyngul's husband works at a market and so does she. She is involved in retail sales of children's toys. Altyngul confidently leads her busy retail business. She always feels that her husband is next to her, and he helps her however he can in his free time. Altyngul has a stable monthly income of close to ten thousand seven hundred som. And seven years ago, when they first started their business, it looked like a fairly fragile enterprise. Then, they obtained a loan and invested close to fifteen thousand som and bought the merchandise. Over the last few years, thanks to this business, they were able to buy a house and furnish it with new furniture. Altyngul requested this loan because she wants to buys merchandise with the goal of expanding the selection. In the future, her plans also include buying a car, repairing a house and buying a cow. Altyngul's partners are: Roza T. is 35 years old. She is a mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Roza's husband works at a construction site, and Roza is involved in sales. Roza hopes to obtain this loan and buy merchandise. Baktygul U. is 37 years old. Her husband is retired, and Baktygul works at a distillery. Together they are raising two children. Baktygul needs a loan in order to buy furniture. Mira M. is 42 years old. She has three children, and in order to support the family, both she and her husband have to work. Her husband is involved in passenger transportation. Mira is involved in sales of groceries. She requested this loan because she wants to buy merchandise in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica, es la preparación y venta de jugos de frutas frescas por las mañanas y por las tardes gaseosas y demás bebidas. Los productos que más demanda tiene son los  extractos de piña y zanahorias, así como jugos de papaya sin azúcar y de otras preparaciones combinados de dos frutas. Atiende todos los días en su establecimiento desde hace 8 años, siendo sus clientes comerciantes del mercado aledaño a su negocio. Lo que más le gusta es trabajar tranquila, además que le resulta rentable, pues lo realiza en su casa y eso le permite estar al pendiente de su familia. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar y diversificar su negocio. Es el quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además dice que le será muy útil para el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar una máquina de moler y exprimir cañas de azúcar, ya que por esta zona no vende este tipo de extracto de fruta.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and lives in her own house in the company of her husband and her 4 children. Her work is preparing and selling juices made from fresh fruit in the mornings, and in the evenings she sells soft drinks and other beverages. The products in greatest demand are pineapple and carrot juice, as well as papaya juice without sugar and other preparations made from combinations of two fruits. She has worked every day in her business for the past 8 years, and her clients are traders from the market next to her business. What she likes best is working calmly. The business is profitable for her, since she carries it out in her home, and this allows her to be available for her family. Her plans for the future are to expand and diversify her business. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time. She also says that the loan will be very useful for the growth of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she is planning to buy a machine to grind and squeeze juice from sugar cane, since in her area, no one is selling this type of fruit extract.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a machine to grind and squeeze juice from sugar cane

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is currently in the business of washing and ironing customers' clothes at the laundry shop and is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of soap and washing powder. Betty is 33 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Stock more boxes of soap and washing powder

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion A. is a married woman who lives in Sayao, Bantigue, Bantayan, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: fishing and fish vending businesses. Her husband, Sandy A., who is 32 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between 9 to 13 yrs old years old. Salvacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Salvacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, which she intends to use for the purchase of fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and for the education of her children. Salvacion A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Alba Alejandrina

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Alejandrina Z. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Danli, Alba se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería negocio que opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “ELSA” y ubicado en su casa de habitación.

Cabe mencionar que las condiciones de vida de la sra. Z. han mejorado notablemente gracias a su negocio.

Doña Alba es casada y su esposo es comerciante,  producto del matrimonio dio a luz a dos hijas de las cuales una esta casada y una en edad media y que en la actualidad esta cursando sus estudios universitarios. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba Alejandrina Z. is 40 years old and lives in the Nueva Esperanza division of the city of Danli. She is a merchant who operates a grocery business under the name “Elsa”, which is located in her home. It should be noted that her living conditions have improved dramatically as a result of her business.

Doña Alba is married and her husband is also a merchant. Two daughters resulted from their marriage. One is married while the younger one is currently attending university. This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business so that she can improve her sales and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta B. is from the town of Panglao. She is 45 years old. Vicenta, married and has 2 school-aged children. Vicenta is engaged in fishing. She has a fishing boat that her husband operates. She sells all his catch to the market. She also dries some fish.  Vicenta and her family depend on their fishing business.

Vicenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat and purchase fishing hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to repair borrower's fishing boat and purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan T. is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married. She has a daughter and a son. Three years ago with the initial investment of 3000 soms, Uulkan and her husband started to breed poultry. In the begining they had 30 hens and now they have increased that number to 70. Selling eggs and some hens, Uulkam makes 3750 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase feed for the hens. In the future she plans to expand their family business and increase their flock to 500. 

Jumagul J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 46 and married. Her husband works as a post officer. They have two sons and a daughter. Seven years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Jumagul rented a kiosk and started to sell convenience goods. In this way she makes 6000 soms per month.  That profit made it possible for her to save money and open her own shop. With money received from the loan, Jumagul wants to purchase convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. 

Oktom U., 66, is married. She has a son who is a farmer. Oktom and her husband grow potatoes and breed cattle. They make money by selling potatoes and farm lafter fattening. Oktom hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to cover her personals expenses. 

Buaisha U., 52, is married. She has two sons and two daughters. Buaisha and her husband are farmers. They grow potatoes and maize and breed livestock animals. With money received from the loan, they want to purchase two sheep in order to increase the number of their livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hens

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa Q., vive en la zona D. Mallco Chapi – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Q. es una persona sencilla y humilD., casada y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando en el colegio. 
Se dedica a la agricultura y la cría D. ganado vacuno con la ayuda D. su esposo y su hijo. Esto les permite tener ingresos para mantener a su familia.

En los últimos años a notado que sus ingresos han disminuido porque no ha podido alimentar adecuadamente a su ganado por no tener alimento suficiente para sus animales.

El motivo principal para que ocurra esto ha sido el cambio climático y escases D. agua en la zona donD. vive. 
Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socia D. un pozo D. agua que le permita regar sus plantas incrementando su producción, alimentar a sus animales y D. esta manera tenga mayores ingresos para educar y vestir a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolasa Q. lives in the Mallco Chapi – Sipe Sipe area, in the province of Quillacollo in Cochabamba region. 

Señora Q. lives simply and humbly, she is married anad has one son, who is studying in high school. She dedicates her time to farming and raising cattle, with the help of her husband and their son. This enables them to bring in enough income to sustain the family. 

In recent years she has noticed her income has been declining, because she has not been able to feed her cattle adequately. This is because she has not enough food for them.

The main reason this has happened has been the climate change and water shortages in the area where she lives. It is for this reason that she has asked for a loan: to be able to be a member of a communal well that will permit her to give her plants water, increase their productivity and feed her animals. In this way she will have better income with which to educate and clothe her family.

loans.use: To pay for the use of a well for irrigation

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over eight years, she has operated a food stall business, selling maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil, operating from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatime faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of beans, a gallon of cooking oil, three bales of maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of beans, a gallon of cooking oil, three bales of maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Daniel Ngugi

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 7 years.  He is 45 years old, married to Josephine Wairimu, and they have 5 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a polythene roll for his greenhouse and a water tank which will allow him to farm using the drip irrigation method.

In future, Stanley hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a polythene roll for his greenhouse and a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Buyannemeh

texts.en:
Buyannemeh T., 41 years old, lives with her husband and three children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. Her oldest two children both attend a vocational training school and her youngest son attends a local high school. Her husband operates a taxi service and earns monthly revenues of 100,000 and 150,000 MNT.

Buyannemeh operates a shoemaking business. She sews a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes according to her customer's orders. She started her business in 2006 and has since gained much experience as a shoemaker. Over the years, she has managed to establish her business as a stable operation and her working capital now exceeds 900,000 MNT. Buyannemeh is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for making 32 pair of traditional shoes.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who live in Ta Hing village in Kandal province. This group loan selected Mrs. Chea S.,who is 51 years old, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their familys' standard of living. 

Mrs. Chea S. and her husband, Mr. Phon Phoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate peanuts to sell to support their family. However, they do not have enough money to continue farming. So, Mrs. Chea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy peanut seeds for cultivating. 

This couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are students and also support their parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For over 11 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Lucy faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a bigger tailoring shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase rolls of cloth materials for tailoring and wheat flour for her doughnut business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of cloth materials for tailoring and wheat flour for her doughnut business

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: Monsieur    Djifa  est  âgée de 30 ans. Il est né  à Lomé et  habite quartier  Adidogomé.   Il exerce comme activité   la vente de carte de recharge et s’approvisionne  à la direction Togocel, Moov et Togotelecom.  Il a commencé l’activité en 2008 et revend les cartes à la douane  d’Adidogomé. Il a employé une  personne qui  l’aide  dans ces tâches.  Il sollicite  un prêt  pour acheter   10 cartes illico Togotelecom, 150 cartes Togocel et 10 cartes Moov.
texts.en: Mr Djifa is 30 years old. He was born in Lomé and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He sells recharge cards for mobile phones. He gets his supplies at the headquarters of Togocel, Moov and Togotelecom. He began this activity in 2008 and retails the cards at the customs office in Adidogomé. He has hired one employee to help him in his business. He applies for a loan to buy 10 "illico" cards for Togotelecom phones, 150 cards for Togocel phones and 10 cards for Moov phones.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards for mobile phones

loans.name: German

texts.en: German is 45 years old, married, and has four children. He is a member of the communal bank, "Los Laureles" at FINCA Peru in Ayacucho and was introduced to the bank by his wife. He has had a mototaxi business for three years now. Previously he had an office job for 15 years but left because he wanted to have his own business. He has been able to use his savings to purchase another mototaxi and wants to continue to increase his business and eventually buy a house. German will be using his loan of 750 PEN to purchase gasoline and parts and accessories to maintain his mototaxis.

loans.use: Maintenance of mototaxi and purchase of gasoline

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 52 años de edad, viuda y tiene 9 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de comida ella vende en el mercado de Chimpahuaylla y en la plazoleta de ahí mismo, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en esta actividad del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz, aceite, menestras, carnes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old and a widow with nine children. Hilda sells food at the Chimpahuaylla Market and in the market square. She sells as a traveling vendor to all of her customers who ask for her food. Hilda enjoys working and feels happy that her business helps her family move forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her business such as rice, oil, vegetables, and meats according to what she needs.

Hilda is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Norigen

texts.en:
Norigen E. is from the village of Kahulugan, Kimaya, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Norigen is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Norigen owns & operates a specialized retail store selling green bananas & coconuts for copras in the local community. Norigen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norigen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norigen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Norigen is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green and yellow bananas & coconuts. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Norigen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green and yellow bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Mrs. Nary is married to Mr. Tang Oun, who is a soldier. Together, they have 3 children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and another is studying in local public school. Mrs. Nary owns a general store in a local village where she earns some profit to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell. Part of the rice crop is used to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Nary is seeking a loan to buy more groceries for the store. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy some piglets for breeding and pig food to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is 36 years old and lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She moved here to a small house after her marriage to N. K.. Her husband operates a crockery-selling business. His shop is located in a nearby market where he runs his business. His shop is filled with different kinds of crockery such as glass, steel, and plastic, which helps him to target every kind of buyer. 

Nazia is a caring lady who stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will purchase more crockery to put in his shop to sell. Nazia hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income by selling the crockery to many more customers. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident about her husband’s business growth. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick B. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Patrick has a poultry firm, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed for the chickens he raises for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto de 41 años, es soltero, tiene casa propia que cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, se encuentra ubicado en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por que la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Walberto se dedica a la comercialización de arroz en cáscara, es un mercado que tiene mucha competencia pero también es amplio, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animlaes (aves de corral como cabras), losingresos de ambas actividades le permite solventar sus gastos personles.

Al ver que su negocio va incrementando sus ventas a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles para seguir comprando arroz en cáscara y comercializarlo, ésto le ayudará a tener más ganacias para cubrir su crédito como para  tener un mejor nivel de vida.   Walberto es un cliente antiguo para la empresa y a demostrado ser un cliente fiel y muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Walberto, 41, is single.  He owns his house that has water and electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Lambayeque Department.  This zone is characterized by the activities its residents engage in: farming, raising livestock and tourism.

Walberto has been selling unhulled rice for several years.  It’s a market with much competition but also a wide one.  He also raises barnyard fowl and goats to sell.  Income from both activities makes it possible for him to meet personal expenses.

Seeing that his business is growing, he’s though it convenient to request an 1800 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to continue buying unhulled rice to sell.  This will help him earn higher profits to repay the loan and to have a better standard of living.

Walberto is a longstanding client of the firm and has shown himself to be a faithful, very responsible client with respect to his payments.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of unhulled rice.

loans.name: Johnny Alfredo

texts.es:
JOHNNY ALFREDO tiene 25 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

JOHNNY ALFREDO se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz hace 5 años, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y salir adelante.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Johnny Alfredo is 25 years old.  He’s single living with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He does not have children.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Johnny Alfredo has farmed corn for the last five years.  He does his purchases in Ventanas and his sales at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are competition and weather variations.  

His dream is to continue working and get ahead.  He likes working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man from Qana. He has been manufacturing aluminum windows, doors, and closets for two years. 

His work is of a good quality, and most builders in the region deal with him. In order to improve his business, Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time to buy necessary aluminum stock to finish a requested project. 

Ahmad works hard to improve his business and to increase his customer base. He's also building his own house and will invest part of his loan to buy necessary iron pillars and cement to finish part of it. 

He hopes to make a small loving family, in addition to owning a factory of his own and to stop paying rent for another's.

loans.use: To buy aluminum stock and to finish some home renovation

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is a mother of a 4-year-old child who is in school. Her husband is a farmer and Claudine owns a general store in which she sells different items such as salt, cooking oil, sugar, soap, etc. She has run this business for four years and it is doing well. This business has enabled Claudine to develop herself and improve her family's standard of living. She needs a loan to buy more items for her store. Claudine plans to use the anticipated profits to begin building her family house.

loans.use: to purchase salt, cooking oil, sugar, soap, and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: María Elicita

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Las Divinas De Mejía. Ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 39 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 20, 17, 14, 11 y 6 años de edad, los tres menores  estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio de él, el cual se dedica a la venta de pescado, para esto él se desplaza hasta las playas de Crucita para realizar su labor, allí todos los días en las mañanas él compra el pescado a los pescadores que llegan  de alta mar, luego los limpia y vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona y ellos los trasladan a distintos lugares de la provincia, él vende al por mayor y también al menudeo a personas que viven por la localidad, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ayuda a su marido  su negocio. 

Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que a estos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The town of Mejía is located a few kilometers away from the city of Portoviejo. It is here that the Communal Bank “Las Divinas de Mejía” meets every 15 days. Most of the people in this town engage in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María. She is 39 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children (ages 20, 17, 14, 11, and 6). Her three younger children are in school and her husband is a merchant.

María is a homemaker who helps her husband with the household expenses. She is taking out a loan for his business. Her husband is a fish vendor and must travel to the beaches of Crucita in order to conduct business. He goes there every morning to buy the catch of the fishermen who have arrived from the high sea. He cleans the fish before selling them to merchants who come to the area from different places within the province. María’s husband sells in bulk, as well as smaller amounts for the local residents. She says that her husband has been in business for more than 15 years and has done well thanks to God.

This loan will be used to buy fish to sell. This is María’s second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her husband’s business.

Her dream is to provide her children the best so that they lack nothing.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her husband's business.

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucila Del Carmen tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio  ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad económica el empeño y dedicación que le brinda han hecho que ella pueda obtener un medio de vida mucho más estable para su familia. Ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ella solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa, tratamientos, ropa en general, calzado entre otros.
texts.en: Lucila Del Carmen is 27. She sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over 4 years. She is a very enterprising person and benefits from her work. The hard-work and dedication that she puts into it has meant that she has been able to achieve a much more stable lifestyle for her family. She has 2 young children under her care. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing, treatments, general clothing, and shoes, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, treatments, general clothing, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (eight orphans from her late sister). Hope has a business selling local medicine.  She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week.  Hope sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Hope has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bottles and tins of powdered local medicine. The main business challenge(s) for Hope include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a permanent business premise, to be a wholesaler and to buy a plot in order to build her own house. Hope lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bottles and tins of local medicine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a charming 32-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who are school-going. For the last two years, he has been selling shoes to make a living. He makes extra shillings by engaging in farming. Previously, he used to be employed. 

In the next five years, he wants to have expanded his business and created job opportunities for others. His dream is to accumulate wealth. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he can now easily access credit.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
La señora Magdali, es casada  con el señor  José Ariel y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun estaña su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carne,  tortilla, aceite, repollo, entre otros para la elaboración de taco, en donde lleva practicando   dos años y ocho meses  y comenta que le va bien.

     Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de  la casa, para así sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
 
     Lo que más desea es  que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir aumentando su ganancia, así  a poyar a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Magdali is married to José Ariel and the couple have three children who are still their responsibility.

Magdali requested this loan to invest in buying ingredients such as meat, tortillas, oil, cabbage, etc. for making tacos.  She has been in this business for two years and eight months and she tells us that it is doing well.

Magdali decided to start this business as she wanted to support her husband by making income for their household in order to get their family ahead in life.  Her family is the most important thing in the world to her.

What Magdali would most like is to be able to gradually increase her income through her business so that she can support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tacos

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona, age 46, operates a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has run this business for 10 years. She and her husband have five children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 
 
Alona has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Alona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 43 años, convive con Delia, su esposa, producto de su amor nació Ruger. Los tres en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio el palomar (selva central peruana). Este hombre trabajador menciona que hace poco tiempo decidió invertir en la siembra de más plantas de café. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a la agricultura, sus principales productos constan de café, plátanos y maíz; los que negocia en el mercado de su ciudad. Pero según menciona, su producción de café saldrá recién a la venta, ya que la planta de café tarda 3 años en crecer y dar fruto, “ya falta poco”, afirma. Pero como son plantas nuevas darán un excelente grano, eso lo reconforta. La seguridad y proyectos de Raúl son sorprendentes, ahora desea invertir en la siembra de más plantas de plátano, pues sus planes son de adquirir más terrenos agrícolas para aumentar su producción y obtener más ganancias. Ya que sólo tarda 15 días en dar fruto y con eso puede dinamizar sus ventas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Buenos Aires” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde es presidente de su asociación y se siente feliz de dirigir y apoyar a sus integrantes. Por ello promete pagar puntual sus cuotas y de esa manera estimular la responsabilidad. Raúl de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café para realizar viveros y así prepararse para la próxima cosecha del año.
texts.en:
Raúl is 43 years old and lives with his wife Delia. They have a child named Ruger. The three of them live in their own home in the community of Sanchirio El Palomar, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. This hardworking gentleman mentioned that a short time ago he decided to invest in the planting of more coffee crops. Raúl has been farming for five years. His main products consist of coffee, bananas, and corn. He conducts his business at the city market. As mentioned before, his coffee crops are about to be sold since it has taken three years to grow and bear fruit. “It has been too long,” says Raúl. He is comforted by the fact that his new plants have reached an excellent point in their growth. This assurance from his projects is quite amazing. Now he wants to invest in more banana plants, so his plans are to acquire more farmland so that he can increase production and generate more revenue. It only takes 15 days for banana plants to bear fruit, so he will be able to boost his sales.

Raúl is a member of the Communal Bank “Buenos Aires” and this will be his fourth loan with MFP. He serves as president of the association and is happy to direct and support the other members. For this reason, he promises to be prompt with his payments and set a responsible example. With the support he received, Raúl will invest the money he requested in the purchase of coffee seedlings so that he can start a nursery and prepare for next year’s harvest.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seedlings for starting a nursery.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia tiene 55 años D. edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales aún 5 D. ellos son estudiantes y ella los sigue apoyando con los estudios, la socia trabaja junto a sus esposo, la socia en un negocio familiar pero ella sigue trabajando en la región como empleada pública, la socia venD. joyas hechas por su esposo en la institución en la que labora, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. joyas, la socia comprara alambres, piedras, mostacillas, ganchitos, pies y todo ello para la elaboración D. joyas como aretes, collares, pulseras entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. joyas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas D. acuerdo al cronograma D. pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria is 55 years old, married, and has seven children.  Five of her children are still in school and she continues supporting them in their education.  Maria works together with her husband in a family business but she also continues working as a civil servant.  Maria sells jewelry maD. by her husband in the institution in which she works.  She would like to invest her loan in buying materials for making jewelry.  She will buy wire, stones, beads, hooks and other items she needs for making pieces of jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc.

Maria is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María De Los Ángeles tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, desde hace 6 años tiene este negocio. Ella anteriormente tenía la venta de comida, fue con el paso del tiempo que ella decide establecer esta pulpería para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad en sus productos es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, galletas, sopas, papel higienico y enlatados.
texts.en: María De Los Ángeles has a grocery store business.  She has been in this business for six years.  She previously had a business selling food.  Over time, she decided to set up a grocery store so that she could offer her customers a variety of products.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, candies, bread, cookies, soups, toilet paper and canned food.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, bread, cookies, soups, toilet paper and canned food

loans.name: Rocio Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Roció  tiene como actividad la venta de comida y la atención de un kiosco donde vende dulces y galletas, esta actividad la desarrolla todos los días de la semana, ella es una persona joven muy trabajadora su familia esta compuesta por su esposo quien también trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un club de la ciudad de La Paz y sus dos  pequeños hijos de 10 y 4 años, el destino del crédito es para compra de material de construcción para la refacción del kiosco donde ella trabaja y la compra de mercadería como dulces y galletas para surtir con variedad de productos su kiosco y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Roció  has as her activity the sale of food and tending a stall where she sells candies and cookies.  She performs this activity every day of the week.  She is a young person and a hard worker.  Her family is composed of her husband, who also works as a kitchen assistant in a club of the city of La Paz and her two small children ages 10 and 4 years.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase building material for the repair of the stall where she works and to purchase merchandise such as candies and cookies to supply her stall with a variety of products and in this manner to improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: repair her stall and buy merchandise

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from the village of Partskhanakanebi in West Georgia. He is 35 years old, married and lives with his family – his wife Khatuna, their 7 year-old daughter and 6 year-old son. The children go to the village school. 

The main source of income for the family is 2 greenhouses, with a total area of 600 square meters. The greenhouses are busy during the whole year. lIn the fall, winter and spring, greens are grown there.  In summer months, the greenhouses are used for tomato and cucumber growing. Gocha sells the harvested products himself on the local wholesale market.  The family also has a milk cow and 2 calves. Khatuna produces cheese and Gocha sells it on the same market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Gocha also has a wood framework for a third greenhouse. With the requested loan, he will purchase polyethylene to cover the construction and in December he will launch the third greenhouse. The family will harvest 50% more greengrocery products, which will significantly increase the income of the family. Gocha and Khatuna will be able to purchase additional household goods, as well as new books and toys for their children, in order to make their lives happier.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene to cover the greenhouse construction

loans.name: Bineta Mbengue

texts.fr: Madame Bineta habite au Sénégal et est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 20 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur de la restauration.  Elle pratique la vente de petit déjeuner et déjeuner, et capitalise une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Mais elle est surtout intéressée par les revenus qui lui sont procurés. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de denrées alimentaires qui entre dans la préparation des repas qu’elle vend  tels que riz, huile, haricots, etc... Son objectif est d’acheter en quantité assez importante pour bénéficier  de prix plus compétitifs mais aussi pour gagner du temps et ne pas avoir a se déplacer chaque jour pour acheter ce dont elle a besoin. Elle souhaite ainsi accroitre la rentabilité de son activité car ses bénéfices lui  permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Bineta lives in Senegal and is 49 years old. She has seven children from 10 to 20 years old. She works in catering, offering breakfasts and lunches. She has more than 15 years experience in this business, which she chose because she has a  passion for it. However, she is particularly interested in the income it generates. 

Madame Bineta has been a member of one of the UIMCEC branches since August 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs to buy basic ingredients, such as rice, oil, and beans, for the meals that she sells. Her goal is to make her purchases in large enough quantities to benefit from more competitive prices, but also to save time and not have to go out every day to buy what she needs. Thus she hopes to increase the profitability of her business, as the profits would allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the meals she prepares.

loans.name: Edendo

texts.en:
Edendo is a married man from the town of Luna in the province of Isabela. Edendo and his wife are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Edendo does his best to improve their business and take care of their three children.

At this time, Edendo is requesting a loan of P30,000 to purchase quality seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Edendo hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase quality seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 36 years old, is a single mother with three children ranging from five months to 21 years old. She describes herself as an efficient and hardworking woman. She sells medicine and provides maternity services to frequent customers. She has one employee and has been in this business for seven years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the pharmacy. She will use this loan of KES 20,000 to buy more medicine. Susan dreams of expanding her business and hopes that it will be the most preferred among the others by the customers in the area.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Jairo Benito

texts.es:
Jairo de 41 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, soltero, dueño de un cyber y librería . Inicio con su actividad de comercio y servicio hace 5 años cuando el tenia 36 años de edad. Este ha sido su primer negocio. La falta de empleo y la difícil situación económica lo impulso a buscar un medio de subsistencia  y así fue que empezó su negocio.  El cual esta ubicado en un buen lugar y que resulta de mucha utilidad para los estudiantes de secundaria y universitarios así como a la población en general.   
El solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora, artículos de la librería y dar  mantenimiento a las otras maquinas. Pues con un buen servicio y maquinas funcionando al 100% su clientes se sienten mas atraído recibe mas ingresos y lo hace un negocio muy rentable. Tiene como expectativa comprar tres computadoras nuevas e invertir en compra de artículos para la librería.
texts.en:
Jairo is 41 years old. He lives in the city of León, is single, and the owner of a cyber cafe and bookstore. He started his business and service activity 5 years ago when he was 36 years old.
