Through his business, he has been able to change from subsistence farming to commercial farming. His dream is to buy more land and increase coverage of the tea plantation. Dismus intends to use the loan funds to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: To buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: C5293 Imboneramurimo Group

texts.en:
Anastase is 33 years old and is married with two children between the ages 8 and 3 years old. Anastase is the leader of this group, called Imboneramurimo. This group contains seven people: three women and four men.

Anastase owns a small shop which sells different kinds of spare parts. Anastase has three years experience and his shop is open from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Anastase and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses.  With the loan, Anastase and his group will be able to earn more profits, which will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Harriet has a furniture workshop/carpentry business, which she has run for five years. She is also a salary earner. 
To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Harriet hopes to expand her workshop further.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Erhbayar

texts.en: Erhbayar B. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in the Songinohairhan section of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His daughter is in a kindergarten. He used to operate a coal-trading business but left it to go into business selling clothes at the Narantuul market, which is largest in the city. Last year, he opened a new business selling bicycles and quickly built up a stable and successful operation.  His current goal is to expand his bicycle business and one day open his own trading center. He is a modest, honest man and is applying for a loan for 1,100,000 MNT to buy and assemble more bicycles.

loans.use: To buy and assemble more bicycles for sale

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely Y. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 60 years old. Fely is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Fely runs a general store. Fely has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month.

In 2006, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Fely is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be the ninth loan taken by Fely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Providence

texts.fr: Providence N. est née a Rwanda, et elle a 2 enfants entre 2 ans et 6 ans.  Elle a fini 6 ans d’école post-primaire, et 1 de ses enfants va a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de 4 sacs de ciments, un camion de pierre, 2 portes, un tuyau pour l’installation de l’électricité, et main d’œuvre pour renouveler sa maison, qu’elle va louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de renouveler sa maison pour obtenir un revenu de la location de sa maison qui est plus élevé.  Elle voudrait changer son métier pour travailler pour elle seule, scolariser ses enfants, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Providence N. was born in Rwanda. She has two children aged 2 and 6. She completed six years of secondary studies, and one of her children attends school. 

She will use her loan to buy four sacks of cement, a truck load of rocks, two doors, a pipe to hook up the electricity, and the labor needed to renovate her house, which she plans to rent out. Her business growth strategy is to renovate her house to increase her rental income. 

She wants to change her occupation to become self-employed, provide her children with an education, and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of cement, a truck load of rocks, two doors, a pipe for the electricity hook-up, labor

loans.name: Vicente Martin

texts.es: Vecente Martin C.: de 29 años tiene 3 hijos es casado el trabaja todos los dias en su barberia atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes, y asi poder quedar bien con sus clientes, trabaja juntamente con sus trabajadores haciendo cortes de cabello de deferentes estilos, el le da gracias a Dios porque le a hido bien en su negocio a prosperado considerable mente, el solicita el credito para comprar otras maquinas para cortar cabello,y tambien para comprar utencilios para su barberia como por ejemplo: cremas,gelatinas y tintes para el cabello su sueño es poder tener otro local donde poder atender a la clientela y asi mejorar economicamente.
texts.en:
Vicente Martin C. is 29 years old, married, and has three children. He works every day at his barber shop where he provides friendly service to his customers. Vicente gets along well with his customers and partners with his co-workers to provide haircuts in different styles. He thanks God because he has done well and his business has prospered considerably.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy other machines for cutting hair. He will also purchase barber supplies such as hair creams, gels, and dyes. His dream is to open another shop where he can attend to his customers and improve financially.

loans.use: Purchase machines for cutting hair, hair creams, gels, and dyes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Develop her retai business and fatten livestock

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: L. señora Angélica María P. D. L. C. desD. hace 4 años se dedica a L. venta D. ropa usada, negocio que actualmente le ha ofrecido un ingreso para el sostén D. L. familia. En este momento desea comprar ropa D. temporada que se aproxima como lo es el verano, pues en esta ciudad L. temperatura son muy altas  y L. gente busca ropa ligera para soportar el calor, D. esta manera elL. obtendrá mejores ganancias al tener mercancía variada
texts.en: For four years Señora Angélica María P. D. L. C. has sold used clothing, a business that now offers her an income for the support of her family. Now she wants to buy clothing for the season that is coming, the summer, since in this city the temperatures are very high and the people look for lightweight clothing so that they can tolerate the heat. In this way, she will have better earnings by having a variety of merchandise

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda A. is from the village of Aplaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Melinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods,  shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Melinda is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 53 year old and is married with three children between the ages of 20 and 23 years old. She has owned a small business for  eight year's of experience. She sells a variety of products like books, soft drinks, and cooking oil. This business is well-organized. She starts from 6 am until 8 pm daily and she employs one person to help her.

Marceline has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by purchasing more goods such as books, soft drinks, and cooking oil to sell. With this profit, She will reinvest  in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as books, soft drinks, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gyan Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Gyan Maya M., who is married and has three children aged 20, 18 and 11, established her grocery store business in 2001. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she is able to support her family. Gyan Maya has already received and repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, she plans to continue to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Maria Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni es una señora D. 37 años D. edad que vive hace 10 años con su esposo e hija, en casa D. su madre. Todos ellos son una familia muy unida. Viven en el distrito D. Patapo en Chiclayo. Esta comunidad es una comunidad D. comerciantes y también existe una gran cantidad D. personas que laboran para empresas azucareras que se encuentran ubicadas en la  zona.

Marleni tiene una pequeña bodega D. comestibles y además comercializa todo tipo D. ropa y calzado para adultos y niños, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 6 años desD. su domicilio. 

Marleni tiene buenas perspectivas para su negocio, ella piensa ampliarlo y llegar a comercializar otros productos, como accesorios D. vestir y artículos para el hogar.

Gracias a su negocio, Marleni cuenta con una buena calidad D. vida y  su hija goza D. estos beneficios también. Marleni solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para volver a invertir en el negocio que tanto le produce, específicamente ella quiere comprar prendas D. vestir y calzado D. la nueva temporada, pues sus clientes lo solicitan.

Marleni ha cancelado con puntualidad los créditos que Edpyme Alternativa le ha brindado con anterioridad.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 37-year old woman who has lived with her husband and daughter together in her mother's house. They form a very close family. They live in the district of Patapo in Chiclayo. It is a community of merchants and a large number of individuals works in the sugar factories of the region.

Marleni has a small grocery store and she also sells all types of clothing and shoes for adults and children. She has managed her business from her house for the past 6 years.

Marleni has good ideas for her business. She plans on expanding it and to start selling other products, such as accessories and articles for the home.

Thanks to her business, Marleni enjoys a good quality of life and her daughter also enjoys these benefits. Marleni requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 2000 nuevos soles to invest in her successful business. Specifically, she wants to purchase articles of clothing and shoes for the new season as requested by her clients.

Marleni has repaid past loans on time with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Kankaylay Primary School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in September 1985 by the Kankaylay Mission to bring education to the community. Kankaylay Primary School is staffed with 9 able teachers and has an enrollment of 273 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Abdulai, 60 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in the village of Jojoima and has been in the teaching profession for 30 years. He is married and has 4 children who attend primary and secondary schools. Abdulai has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron, etc.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es: Eduardo es un hombre de 63 años de edad,  es casado, tiene  4 hijos en las edades de 25 a 38 años y vive en el barrio Carrizal, comunidad alegre, solidaria y de gente trabajadora, que combina perfectamente la buena música y las actividades microempresariales. Allí en este ambiente Eduardo se dedica a la fabricación de calzado femenino e infantil, a la cual se dedica desde que tuvo 14 años de edad, cuando fue ayudante de su padre,  para finalmente aplicar toda su experiencia técnica en el oficio de zapatería,  en un negocio    con el que ha logrado avanzar a su familia y al que le debe la totalidad de sus ingresos porque como él dice “ siempre ha tenido trabajo, gracias a Dios y no pasa necesidades” En la actualidad está muy cerca a comprar la vivienda donde habita pues es arrendada y es en ella donde ha vivido con su familia desde que se casó. Su negocio ha avanzado mucho, especialmente por el cariño y respecto con que trata a sus clientes, por eso la conserva,  y es bien reconocido en el sector por ser  una persona muy responsable en su vida personal y en su negocio. Con su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará materiales e insumos para cumplir los compromisos adquiridos con sus clientes, pues ellos le han solicitado a Eduardo nuevos y modernos diseños, por lo cual su inversión será exitosa. Su sueño es continuar trabajando para aumentar sus utilidades que están en un margen  no inferior al 25%, para muy pronto poder cumplir la meta de ser propietario de una vivienda.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 63 year-old man who is married and has four children aged between 25 and 38.  He lives in Carrizal neighborhood, a cheerful and supportive community full of hard-working people, which combines to perfection good music and microbusiness activities.

To be found in the middle of this environment is Eduardo who makes women's and children's footwear.  He has been in this business since he was 14 years old when he worked as an assistant to his father.  Eventually, he applied all of his technical experience to the footwear trade and started a business through which he has got his family ahead in life.  It is to this business that he owes all of his income because, as he says, "I have always had work and, thanks to God, I don't want for anything".  Eduardo is currently very close to being able to buy the rental home in which he has lived with his family since he was married.

Eduardo has made a lot of progress in his business, in particular due to the affection and respect with which he treats his customers.  This is how he keeps his customers and he is well known in the trade as being a very responsible person both in his personal life and in his business dealings.

This Kiva loan is Eduardo's first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy materials and supplies with which to fulfil his obligations to his customers as they have requested new and modern designs from him.  For this reason, his investment will be successful.

Eduardo's dream is to continue working in order to increase his profits which have a margin of no less than 25%.  He hopes that he will soon fulfil his goal of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for his shoe workshop

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila, 39, resident of GMA City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a Community Leader, and mother to a young working adult and a simple stay-at-home who manages the household while she attends to her business.

Leonila operates a candle making business. She buys raw materials used in candle making and processes them to make candle. Her finished products are distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products and she earns a small margin for every candle that she delivers. Aside from her candle-making business, she also operates a small store where people can buy their basic school supplies. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in candle making and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonila dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to tap more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials used in her candle-making business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been tailoring since 1992. He is 44 years old, married and a father to five children aged 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6. Through Faulu Kenya, Charles has grown his business, thus raising his family's standard of living.

In the next five years, Charles hopes to expand his business in order to get enough income to educate his children. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fabric. Charles appears in the photo with his wife and two of his children.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Súper Bankito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive su hija menor que es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años. Su esposo es mecánico pero ya no trabaja por motivos de enfermedad.

Nuestra amiga sufre de discapacidad pero esto no le impide ganarse sus sustento diario, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. el nombre de su tienda es “Mini Marquet Mechita “allí   trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, su esposo trabaja con ella y su hija cuando no está ocupada también  le ayudan en su trabajo.  Nos cuenta que  lleva más de 30 años con su tienda  y le va muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren porque en su local encuentran de todo y sobre todo una muy buena atención.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the Super Bankito community bank meet every fornight in the citadel of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of Los Reales Tamarindos since colonial times. 

Here we meet Mercedes, 58 years old, who is married with five children, all of them grown up. Her youngest daughter, who is a single mother of a girl of 4, lives with her. Mercedes' husband is a mechanic but he no longer works due to an illness. 

Mercedes is disabled, but this doesn't prevent her from earning a living. She owns a grocery store which she runs from her home. She sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.. The name of her store is "Mini Marquet Mechita". She works there every day from 6am to 10pm. Her husband works with her and her daughter also helps whenever she isn't busy. She says she's had her shop for over 30 years and things are going well.Her customers prefer her shop because they can find everything and above all get a very good service. 

She's planning to use the credit to buy more stock for her shop. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats and other staples. She's been with her community bank for 5 cycles and she enjoys it because she's made friends within the group. 

Her goals are for her business to get ahead and her store to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats and other staples.

loans.name: Betel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BETEL” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de deportivos, medicina natural, pollerera, venta de humintas, costura, carnicería.

La señora Sonia,  indica que este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de un banco. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sal que viene trabajando desde hace treinta años, el que aprendió de sus papás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de sal), que comprara de los salares de Pacajes y posteriormente lo distribuirá a las fábricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la verificación en el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Betel" will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Santiago II central office.  This group is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Sonia.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses including selling: vegetables, sports shoes, natural medicines, traditional clothing, and baked tamales.  The membership also includes a dressmaker and a butcher.

Sonia says that this is her second loan cycle working with Pro Mujer.  She joined because of a recommendation from a bank. She has had a business selling salt for 30 years, a trade she learned from her parents.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital (purchase salt.)  She will buy the salt from the salt flats of Pacajes, and later she will distribute the salt to the factories.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can, because she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the check-ups in the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Anielka Lizeth

texts.es: Anielka Lizeth se dedica a la venta cosméticos, hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Desde muy joven inicio este negocio, pues tenía que pagarse sus estudios  a pesar de que fue con muy poco capital que inicio ha logrado proveerle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pinturas de labios, pintura de uñas, perfumes, cremas, lápiz de ojos entre otros.
texts.en:
Anielka Lizeth sells cosmetics.  She has had this business for over three years.  She started this business when she was very young; she had to pay for her education.  

In spite of having very little capital, she managed to provide her family with the necessary income.

The loan she is requesting is for lipstick, nail polish, perfume, creams, and eyeliner, among other items.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, nail polish, perfume, creams, and eyeliner, among other items.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Luzminda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Luzminda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Dubys

texts.es: Dubys vive en la hermosa e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, ubicada en la costa Caribe de Colombia, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 9 a 2 años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de papelería detalles para obsequios, suéteres, accesorios femeninos y fantasías, en un punto comercial o miscelánea ubicada en su propio hogar. Su experiencia data desde hace 11 años cuan vendía mercancía variada que distribuía persona a persona, como gradualmente fue creciendo comenzó a organizando la variedad de sus artículos en una vitrina en la sala de su casa  y así logró su clientela y posteriormente con el  apoyo de su esposo y su suegro ubicó una sala de internet, actividades productivas que le han ayudado para que con el producto de su trabajo apoye a su hogar con los gastos. Su meta es capitalizar su negocio para lograr un surtido permanente especialmente con la mercancía de mayor venta. Este es propósito de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará papelería, detalles para el hogar, accesorios femeninos, surtido con el que responderá a sus clientes en el mes del amor y amistas, época en la cual se impactan positivamente las ventas.
texts.en:
Dubys lives in the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena de Indias located on Colombia’s Caribbean coast with her husband and three children whose ages range from 9 to 2 years.  She has a business that consists of selling paper goods, gift items, sweaters, women’s accessories and fantasy items, in a commercial point or variety store located in her own house.  

She has 11 years’ experience having started out selling assorted merchandise door to door.  As she gradually grew, she started organizing a variety of items in a display case in her living room and gathered a regular clientele that way.  Later on, with help from her husband and father-in-law, she set up an Internet access room.  These are productive activities that have helped her contribute to household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  Her goal is to capitalize her business to obtain a permanent variety of stock merchandise especially of the items that sell the most.

This is the reason for her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy paper goods, home decorations and women’s accessories, an assortment with which she’ll be able to meet customer demand during the month of friendship and love, a season when sales spike.

loans.use: to buy paper supplies, home decorations and women's accessories.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Eusebia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eusebia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eusebia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Librada

texts.es:
Librada vive en Ciudad del Este, tiene 19 años, ella está estudiando Licenciatura en enfermería. Ella tiene 2 hermanos que también están estudiando en la Universidad. Sus padres trabajan en una empresa familiar, gracias a la cual pudieron hacerles estudiar y salir adelante.
Librada  actualmente trabaja en  una farmacia y también vende ropas los fines de semana .Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, para poder trabajar en su profesión y de esa forma poder no solo ayudarse a si misma por medio de su trabajo, sino ayudar también a su familia y a su comunidad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de una computadora para utilizar en sus estudios, ya que esta es una herramienta muy importante para ella. Además de eso comprará materiales para su universidad.
texts.en:
Librada lives in Ciudad del Este. She is 19 years old and is studying for a nursing degree. She has 2 siblings who are also in college. Their parents work in a family business, thanks to which they were able to make them go to school and get ahead.

Librada currently works in a pharmacy and also sells clothes on the weekend. She very much wants to finish her degree, to be able to work in her profession and thus be able not only to help herself through her work, but also to help her family and her community.

She is requesting this loan to buy a computer to use in her studies, since this is a very important tool for her. She will also buy materials for her university.

loans.use: to buy materials for the university and a computer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 63 años, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta, casada vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos mayores y dos nietos menores D. edad, vive en su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo D. su esposo. Rosa D. dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su bodega, negocio que lo tiene instalado en su propia casa, y ahora es muy concurrida por los vecinos. A todos atienD. con amabilidad,  su bodega lleva ya 4 años D. funcionamiento, tiempo en cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando además con el apoyo D. su esposo para la atención al publico. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona y poder apoyar dándole la facilidad a sus vecinos D. poder adquirir sus productos D. primera necesidad cerca a sus casas y no tener que realizar largos tramos para poder adquirir estos productos. Tiene muchas ganas D. seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos variados al por mayor para surtir su bodega, ya que así podrá tener mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 63 years old. She is a happy and enthusiastic woman who is married and lives with her husband, her 2 adult children, and 2 young grandchildren.  She lives in her own home, which she bought with her husband.  Rosa has a grocery store that she set up in her own home.  The business is now very popular with the neighbors.  She attends to everyone with friendliness, and her store has been in business for 4 years.  Over time, the store has become very well known and busy, and she also counts on the help of her husband to serve the public.  What she likes about her work is that it has maD. her well known in the area, and she is able to help out her neighbors by giving them credit so that they can buy their necessities near their home.  This way, they don't have to travel long distances to be able to acquire the products they need.  She has a strong desire to continue to grow in her line of work and expand her business.  This will be her third loan with MFP, and so she awaits the support of each one of you.  With the sum requested, she will buy a variety of products at wholesale to stock her store, since in this way she will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy grocery products at wholesale

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es: La socia tiene su chichería es un local en el cual vende principalmente la bebida tipica de los incas, la elaboración de la chicha es a base de maíz amarillo macerado, la socia desea invertit en la compra de maíz amarillo y en la elaboración de la chicha.
texts.en: This member has a shop where she sells mostly “chicha”, a traditional beverage of the Incas. Making “chicha” involves the use of ground yellow corn. She wants to invest in the purchase of yellow corn for making “chicha”.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn for making "chicha".

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. He is a businessman from Berdyansk. 

Alexander sells plumbing equipment in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. He has many loyal clients and potential customers as his good quality inventory comes at affordable prices. Alexander has unique advertising techniques that help him to keep his business sustainable. He launched his enterprise 10 years ago.

Alexander is a born entrepreneur, capable of coping with economic challenges and routine struggles every businessman faces each day. His customers characterize him as a businessman of integrity, which is a valuable asset these days.

Alexander is requesting a 5,000 UAH loan to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale in his vending kiosk.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a clothing shop where he sells old clothes to customers. He started the business by getting a loan from HOFOKAM Ltd. He is faced with hardships such as customers not paying on time, price fluctuations and seasonal factors. His dreams are building a permanent house and upgrading in school. His business goals are expanding business into new markets, hiring employees to help him expand the business and moving his business to a more permanent location. Amos wants a loan to buy old clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy old clothes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa est une femme mariée qui  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans et  est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 et 9 ans.  Elle exerce une activité diversifiée de commerce de vente d’habits  et de  repas (petit déjeuner et déjeuner). Elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité.  Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce par amour,  pour gagner des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de quelques denrées qui vont aider a la préparation des repas qu’elle commercialise. Son but recherché est l’accroissement d e ses bénéfices et l’amélioration  des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Awa is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She is 35 years old and has four children aged between one and nine. She has diversified business activities, selling clothing and meals (breakfast and lunch). She has worked in this business for five years. She chose this line of work because she loves it, and also to generate an income that allows her to cover her needs.
 
Madame Awa has been a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC since July 2006. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs to buy fabrics and a few commodities for preparing the meals she sells. Her aim is the increase her profits and the improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell and ingredients for preparing the meals she sells.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a widower with two children.  He is 58 years old and resides at Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines.

Marcos is operating a fishing business, harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community and he has been four years in this business.  Each month he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.

He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional fish to raise.  Marcos has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marcos wants to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: 2 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Côi is 59 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Côi operates a food stall restaurant selling rice noodle dishes. Côi has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients.

In 2010, Côi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Côi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With the profits from the loan, Côi hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, beef, and chicken to make "phở" to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice 50 years old, married, and has six children ranging from twenty-three to thirty-five years. She describes herself as an honest and efficient woman. She has been running a butcher shop for nine years. She has one employee. Her business is located in a busy and favorable market. Her business challenge is shortages of cows and goats. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a goat and sheep for slaughtering. Eunice hopes to own a van to aid in the delivery of meat to her customers in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy a goat and sheep for slaughtering.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Raquel,  tiene su pequeño negocio de librería en su casa de habitacion, su esposo laborando como conductor, dando el apoyo moral y economico a su dos hijos estudiante de secundaria.
Como objetivo es crecer, en su negocio, asi como hacer las mejora a su casa, es por tal razon hara un muro, dando mejor seguridad,  a su propiedad y a su familia, el cual comprara materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra.
texts.en: Doña Raquel has her small paper goods business in her home. Her husband works as a driver, giving moral and economic support to their two children who are students in secondary school. Her goal is to grow her business as well as to improve her house. Therefore she will build a wall, to give greater security to her property and her family. With the loan she will purchase construction materials and begin the work.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make a wall safeguarding her property

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Kem is 64 years old and married with four children. She earns a living through farming rice, while her husband helps to earn more income by repairing motorbikes in a local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Kem with VisionFund. Now she is going to ask for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family for commuting. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce some expenses on motor-taxi.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family for commuting.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 42 years old. He is married with three children aged between 10 and 15 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 21 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by five members of the Yonn Njal Association, represented by Mathias D.. The group hails from Palmarin, a tiny fishing village on the edge of the immense salt flats of the Saloum River delta in central Senegal. Palmarin’s location favors the production of gejj, the salty dried fish that is a staple of traditional Senegalese cooking and is in high demand by housewives throughout the country. The loan will be used to purchase fresh fish from the fishermen of the village, salt and dry the fish on racks in the sun, and transport the finished gejj to markets in distant towns and cities.

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Dried fish production

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is a 36 year old mother with 6 kids. 2 are working, 3 are in school and 1 has been adopted by her sister. Fale has been growing vegetables while her husband worked on their taro plantation. Both of them haven’t got good educations, so weren’t able to find a jobs. They have been working on their land for many years, but weren’t able to improve due to lack of finance. It didn’t really matter to them, until their kids were all grown up and facing problems with no school fees. This encouraged Fale to search for opportunities. It’s now Fale’s 4th loan and she admits that her family is doing much better than before. She can spend and save money every week, with all her children going to school with lunch money every day. She really believes now that a healthy family is a happy family.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, tools to be used for gardening.

loans.name: Serafín

texts.en: Serafín G. and her husband Alfida Betres have four children. Serafín helps support her family by running her furniture manufacturing business. She makes tables, chairs, and various other pieces from scratch, then sells them wholesale to retail stores and distribudors around the province of San Pedro de Macorís. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more wood and tools to take her business to the next level. She has received and repaid several loans of increasingly larger amounts from Esperanza, proving that her business has the potential to keep growing.

loans.use: Purchase wood and tools for shaping, building, sanding, and polishing furniture

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza lives in the town of Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has three children. In order to improve the quality of life for her family, four years ago she decided to begin her own business with the production and sales of tamales and chorizo, because the salary of her husband is small and insufficient for all the needs of living. Thanks to the quality of the products that she prepares and the demand from her clients, her business has been very good and has increased through the recommendations of her clients.

At this time, Esperanza is requesting a loan of $750 dollars that she will use to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her products. She promises to repay this loan in six months. Be a part of the growth of this business and help this family. Esperanza greatly appreciates the trust and support that you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León vive Esperanza, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, hace cuatro años ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de tamales y chorizo, ya que el salario de su esposo es poco e insuficiente para todas las necesidades de su hogar, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora, la demanda por ellos ha sido muy buena y se ha incrementado por las recomendaciones que hacen sus clientes.

En estos momentos Esperanza está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, Esperanza agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing her tamales and chorizo

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan (48) sells sweet rice dishes on the back of her bicycle.  She is separated from her husband and must raise a 14-year-old boy and 9-year-old girl on her own.  Ngan usually only sells her dish in the morning from 5 am to 8 am.  Afterwards, she works as a day laborer.  However, the work is very difficult and dangerous.  She hopes to improve her street food business so that she will not have to work as a day laborer.  She has received a loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva before, and she repaid her loan on time.  She has been able to earn 15-20,000 VND ($0.94-1.25) per day.  With her increased earnings, she bought a bicycle for her children to ride to school.  She hopes to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva again.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Mrs. Ayo A. is 45 years old. She sells rubber shoes and has a milling machine for the milling of garri. She is married with 5 children and lives in Benin City. She started her business in 1976. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more rubber shoes & wrappers for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more rubber shoes & wrappers for sale

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Mr. Marco M. has worked selling fruits and vegetables in various parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 2 years. This business is his family's source of income; Mr. M. and wife both work in the business. Because they want to make an additional investment in the business without leaving themselves without working capital, they are applying for a loan of $1000 for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Marco M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en varias partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo desde hace mas de 2 años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia en el trabajan su esposa y el. Queremos invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarnos por eso solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
I am Parveen K. and I have lived all my life in a small town near Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl. At present, only two of my sons attend school whereas one boy and girl are still small. My husband works as an accountant at a cloth manufacturing power looms company for the meager salary of $50, whereas I make shoes. We now feel the need to increase our income and hence my husband has decided to buy a rickshaw and drive it in the evening till night after his office work. My husband is skilled in driving and I hope he can do well. Please give us a loan for this purpose.

There are two other women who are friends of mine who are also in need of a loan: Basheeran B. requires a loan for their fruit cart. Khalida B. requires a loan for her bed sheets and cushions business, so there are three of us in our group and we guarantee repayment for each other.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en: Mrs. Vanh S., age 44, works selling shell fish at an open air market, making on average around $5 each day of profit. Her husband is a fisherman earning around $2.50 each day. They have four children, three of whom are unemployed and another one is married and works as a fisherman. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a boat to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: Vanh would like to purchase a boat to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Thư, 35 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children, 7 and 2, in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her family has a construction material business for 5 years now. It is a good business. The monthly income is steady at around 300USD. She is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to stock more material.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Thư, 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chị có 2 con, cháu đầu 7 tuổi, cháu út 2 tuổi. Nghề chính của gia đình chị là kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu xây dựng. Gia đình chị làm công việc này đến nay được 5 năm. Trong xu thế phát triển chung, nhiều công trình xây dựng được khởi công nên hàng của gia đình chị luôn bán chạy và được giá. T. nhập mỗi tháng của gia đình chị là 300USD. Nhận thấy đây là một nghề có xu hướng phát triển mạnh trong tương lai, chị Thư tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư cho dự án. Số vốn chị định vay ở vòng tới là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy iron, steel

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco has a seven people in his family: himself, his wife, and his five children. His children are 20, 18, 15, 13 and 12 years old respectively. Ciriaco and his son named Codeudor are employees of the business SOBOLMA LTD, a motortaxi company in Warnes. Motortaxis are important because it is one of the main means of mobilization for city dwellers. They purchased a new motorcycle to transport their clients and to guarantee that they are able to sell their services for a price comparable to the rest of the motortaxi market.

Their predecessors in the institution always complied with repayment of their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

Ciriaco tiene una familia que se encuentra conformada por 7 personas, él, su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 20, 18, 15, 13 y 12 años respectivamente. Ciriaco al igual que su hijo (codeudor) son empleados fijos de la empresa SOBOLMA LTDA. y amobs en sus tiemos libres se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en moto, es decir trabajan como mototaxistas en Warnes. En ambas actividades su nivel de competencia es medio, sobre todo en el de transporte de pasajeros ya que es uno de los principales medios de movilización de los ciudadanos. Compraran un nueva moto para transportarse y para trabajar de acuerdo al precio que este en el mercado. Sus antecedentes en la intitución son excelentes, demostró un cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Buy a New Motorcycle to Improve His Mototaxi Company

loans.name: Teresa  Maria

texts.es:
Teresa Maria R. C. is 43 years old and has finished secondary school. She has four children who still depend on her. She lives in the Víctor Raúl area, in the El Porvenir district of La Libertad province. She started her business with very little merchandise and traveled to the city of Lima to sell bread made in the mountains of La Libertad, manjar blanco (a sweet paste similar to dulce de leche) and other sweets. Thankfully, she had family in that area and has become known among their neighbors and others in nearby area. These days, since she brings bread and other things to Lima to sell, she brings back clothing and other products from there to sell in Trujillo and El Porvenir to her neighbors and friends.

Teresa is a member of the Víctor Raúl communal bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency) and with this money purchased a variety of bread, sweet rolls and sweets. With this loan of 1300 Nuevo Sol ($475), which she will repay in four months, she will travel to Lima to purchase clothes, gift items, and sweatshirts in large quantities as in this season they are the most requested items. Teresa dreams of opening a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Teresa Maria R. C. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene cuatro hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Víctor Raúl en el distrito de El Porvenir en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Teresa inició su negocio lo hizo con poca mercadería, viajaba a la Ciudad de Lima para vender pan elaborado en la sierra de La Libertad, manjar blanco y dulces; gracias a que tiene familiares por esa zona ya se ha hecho conocida con los vecinos y con varias personas de otros lugares cerca de su barrio. Actualmente así como lleva a vender pan a Lima trae ropa y otros productos de allá para venderlos en el distrito de Trujillo y El Porvenir, a sus vecinos y conocidos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con ese dinero compro una variedad de pan, rosca y dulce. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses viajara a la ciudad de Lima para hacer sus compras de ropa, regalos, polares en mayor cantidad ya que por esta temporada le han hecho mayor pedido. La señora Teresa tiene un sueño que es el de ambientar una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. sells t-shirts, materials, underwear, shoes, and other clothing items. She is a single mother and looks after two children.

Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase a larger inventory of goods for resale to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional clothing items to expand the business and increase profits

loans.name: Sabiduría Group

texts.es:
The Sabiduría II Communial Bank is a bank that was started recently with 27 members. Some of the members were invited by members of other communal banks and others were invited by the promoters.

The members have different businesses such as selling fish, fruits, handicrafts, vegetables, groceries, cosmetics by catalog, spare parts and clothing. They sell in different markets in the city of AyaC., in their homes and some sell by traveling from place to place.

The members need loans of different amounts. Some loans are for 300 soles or 600 soles but make up a grand total of 12,600 soles in loans from the communal bank.

The loans will be used to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.

The dreams of the members are to grow their businesses, have their own home, buy nice things and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. El Banco Comunal Sabiduría II es un banco que recién inicia con 27 socias, algunas de las socias fueron invitadas por socias de otros Bancos Comunales, otras fueron invitadas por las promotora.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta pescado, frutas, artesanía, verduras, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, repuestos y ropa.

Sus ventas los realizan en diferentes mercados de la ciudad de AyaC., en sus casas y algunas de manera ambulatoria,

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 12,600 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de tomate, zanahoria, cebolla, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, perfumes, pinturas, pescados, repuestos, chompas y casacas.

Los sueños de las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia, comprar sus artefactos y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija E. is 31 years old. She is a married woman with a six year old child. She became a maize seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has had a general store in her home for one year. She used to sell only bread, but her neighbors were requesting more products from her, so she was motivated to start a general store.

Silvia has also sold tamales for two years. Her husband prepares them, and she offers them in her store.

Silvia also participates in a milk delivery program for poor children in her neighborhood.

She has used the loans she has received to supply her store with more products and to furnish her kitchen.

Silvia would like to purchase land in another area to construct a store there.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Silvia tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 1 año. Ella antes solo vendía pan, pero luego sus vecinas le fueron pidiendo más productos y por ello se animó a instalar una bodega.

Asimismo, Silvia vende tamales desde hace 2 años. Su esposo es quien los prepara y ella los ofrece en su tienda.

Silvia también participa del programa de reparto de vaso de leche a niños pobres en su barrio.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en surtir su tienda con más productos y en amoblar su cocina.

Silvia quisiera comprarse un terreno en otra parte y construir una tienda allí.

loans.use: To supply her store with more products and to be able to furnish her kitchen.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married with a 5-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. Viktor had to find a way to support his family, and that is how he ended up as a taxi driver. He owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. The business is the only source of income for his family. Viktor works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and get to a pick-up a lot faster. 

Viktor has been in this business for 6 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Currently, his daily income is about $30-40. Viktor would like to get a loan for 3400 Grivnas to make repairs to his car. One of his other plans is to eventually repay a loan for his vehicle. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Viktor develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Moussoukoro

texts.fr: Moussoukoro D. est membre a la caisse de liberte6 de l IMCEC/dakar sous le numero 705.Elle est couturiere .elle achete les tissus,les coud pour ensuite les vendre.Elle sollicite un pret pour renforcer son activite.
texts.en:
Moussoukoro D. is a member of the Liberte6 bank of the IMCEC/Dakar under the number 705. She is a seamstress. She buys fabrics for sewing and selling the items produced. She is requesting a loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ni Kadek Widiantari

texts.id: Setelah menikah dengan I Komang Nenten suaminya  Ni Kadek Widiantari dari dulu memelihara 1 induk babi. Dengan hasil yang diperoleh dari penjualan anak babi Widiantari bisa membantu kebutuhan keluarganya.Sekarang induk babinya memiliki 9 ekor anak dan rencananya akan dipelihara. Karena kekurangan modal akhirnya Widiantari mengajukan pinjaman ke Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman 6 bulan dan pembayarannya pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dana ini belum diterimanya dan akan diterimanya.Kandang sudah disiapkan walaupun sederhana hanya memakai bambu dan lantainya semen.Widiantari sudah mulai  mempersiapkan modal untuk anak satu –satunya Putu Agus yang sebentar lagi akan lulus dari SMU dan akan meneruskan ke Universitas. Harapan Widiantari beserta suaminya biar Dinari bisa secepatnya mencairkan dana yang dipinjamnya dan akan dipergunakan untuk memperbesar usahanya.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Widiantari is a wife of I Komang Nenten. She has been raising a breeding pig since she got married to her husband. Now the breeding pig already has 9 piglets. She plans to raise them and sells them when they are grown up. However due to the lack of funding, she is applying for a loan from Dinari. The loan will be a 6 month loan program where she can repay at the end of the loan period.

She already prepared a simple hut for the piglets. She is hoping to use the proceed from the pig farming to finance her only son, Putu Agus, to go to university.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to finance the pig raising activities (Anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Sérgio Abia

texts.pt:
Sérgio Abia M. is 42 years old and was born in Boane, a district in Maputo province. He is married and the father of two children, 2 and 12 years old. In addition to his children, he takes care of his sister-in-law who lives with them.

Sérgio studied though 9th grade, then stopped because financial conditions did not allow him to continue. Sérgio has never moved from this city. He spent his childhood with his family. He works as an electrician at Mozambique Electricity, a public utility company, from 7:30am to 3:30pm. He makes a monthly salary of 7,500 Meticais (MZN) and saves 500 MZN.

This is Sérgio's second loan request with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and his first with Kiva. His first loan was for 13,000 MZN to purchase construction material, and this loan will be for additional construction material. Sérgio anticipates that he will not be able to complete the project with this loan. Thus, he intends to repay the loan early and predicts that he will request another loan of about 20,000 MZN to finish the job. Sérgio appears with his 2-year-old son in the photo.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

Sérgio Abia M. nasceu em Boane, um dos distritos da província do Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade. Casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos, com idade de 12 anos para o primeiro e 2 anos para o segundo. Para alem dos filhos e esposa sustenta uma cunhada que vive com eles.

Sérgio estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras para continuar, sérgio nunca mudou se de cidade, passou a sua infância junto da família, é funcionário da Electricidade de Moçambique com funções de electricista com um horário de trabalho das 7:30 as 15:30, tem um salário mensal de 7500,00mt e poupa mensalmente 500,00mt.

Sérgio solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela segunda vez e primeira no Kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 13.000,00mt tendo aplicado na compra de material de construção e este também de 13.000,00mt vai continuar com a compra de material de construção. Assim o sérgio pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro dado que prevê não conclusão através deste empréstimo. Sérgio aparece na foto com o seu filho de 2 anos.

loans.use: Purchase construction material for his home

loans.name: Uso

texts.en: Uso G. is 49 years old and married with 7 children. He has a shop where he sells provisions like noodles, sugar, detergent and drinks. Uso is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Magda L. J. se dedica a su negocio de venta de gaseosas y jugos comercializados en su propio tramo donde atiende muy amablemente a toda su clientela que visita el mercado para realizar sus compras.

La señora Magda a sus 53 años de edad ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio y esto lo ha llevado a cabo con el apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos que han sido muy bien utilizados para su desarrollo.
Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito y así comprar los productos como bebidas gaseosas y jugos y salir adelante en su negocio
texts.en:
In La Terminal Market in the city of León, Magda L. J. sells commercial sodas and juice in her own area where she gives friendly service to her customers when they come to the market to make purchases. Magda, at fifty-three years old, has succeeded in keeping her business afloat. She has done this with the help of Ceprodel, which has granted her loans in the past -- all of which she has used very well to develop her business. Now she looks to Ceprodel with the hope that she will benefit from a new loan as it enables her to purchase merchandise like soda and juice so that her business will survive.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Абдуразок мужчина 25 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка.Проживает в отдалённом районе Уткансой, расположенном вблизи гор.Жена молодая доярка собственных двух коров.Сам Абдуразок работает в колхозе трактористом.Ему колхоз не выплачивает зарплату , а выдают в начале года продукты питания на проживание(муку, рис , хлопковое масло,и.т.д.)поэтому для дополнительного дохода Абдуразок занимается бизнесом животноводства.Для увеличения Скота он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Abdurazok A. is 25 years old, married and has a child. He lives in a distant Utkansoi district situated near mountains. His wife is a young milkmaid for their own two cows. Abdurazok works as a tractor driver at a collective farm. The farm does not pay him salary, but gives him food products (flour, rice, cottonseed oil, etc.) at the beginning of a year. Therefore, Abdurazok raises cattle to subsidize his income. He wants to obtain this loan to increase cattle headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en:
Suzi S. is currently in the business of selling bread, and she is requesting a loan to expand her business. Suzi is 39 years old and married to a business man. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her bread-baking business.

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
U. Vali dedicates himself to the business of raising livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and four children and also provides for their education. It is important to note that thanks to his hard work he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Vali is hoping for the assistance of IMON with the goal of obtaining a loan of $500. This will allow him to purchase young cattle to increase his herd, so as to earn more income. Both Vali and his loving family will benefit from this loan.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Зокирова Мунавар – женщина, которая при помощи кредитов уже третий год поддерживает свой бизнес по продаже продуктов питания. Она торгует на рынке города Костакоза. Её торговля  всегда кипит, т.к. продукты питания всегда имеют спрос населения. За товаром Мунавар ездит сама, в город Худжанд с оптового рынка. Мунавар хочет на получивший займ закупить ещё дополнительный ассортимент товара( чай, кофе, шоколадные конфеты, карамель) пополнить пустые полки.
texts.en:
Munavar Z. is a woman who has been using loans for three years now to support her business where she sells food products. She sells at the market in Kostakoz. Her sales are always brisk as her products are always in demand among the population. Munavar travels for her products herself to the Khujand wholesale market. Munavar would like to use her loan to purchase more products for her selection (tea, coffee, chocolate candy, caramels) to fill her empty shelves.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for sale

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thư Thị Nguyễn (No. 010114060023) was born in 1977. There are 7 people in her family: her parents-in-law, she and her husband and their 3 children. Her main job is farming. She plants vegetables and breeds pigs. Sometimes, she buys scrap iron T. resell. Her husband is a builder. They have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND.

She is a group leader, and wants T. borrow 6.322.000 VND (or 350 USD) T. breed pigs and poultry. About the other borrowers in her group:

Tâm T. Đoàn (No. 010114060024) was born in 1956. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and daughter. She wants T. borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 300 USD) T. breed pigs and poultry.

Tịnh Thị Tô (No. 010114060028) was born in 1975. She wants T. borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 300 USD) T. plant vegetables and breed pigs.

Miền Thị Hà (No. 010114060030) was born in 1959. She wants T. borrow 5.450.000 VND (or 310 USD) T. buy food for her pigs.

Mỹ Thị Nguyễn (No. 010114060027) was born in 1968. She wants T. borrow 5.450.000 VND (or 310 USD) T. plant vegetables and breed pigs.

Dô Thị Nguyễn (No. 010114060029) was born in 1952. She buys scrap iron T. sell. She wants T. borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 300 USD) T. buy more scrap iron and buy trees T. raise.

Uyên Thị Nguyễn (No. 010114060025) was born in 1974. She wants T. borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 300 USD) T. buy food for her chickens.

T. T. Thị Nguyễn (No. 010114060026) was born in 1982. She lives with her husband and two children. She wants T. borrow 5.450.000 VND (or 310 USD) T. plant vegetables.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita G. is from the village of Clarin. She is 51 years old. Pacita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a service-based business. This business provides construction services to local community members. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1999, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Matchi

texts.fr: Marié et père de 03 enfants, ce monsieur vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé à  Lomé. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, ce monsieur s’est lancé en 2004 dans le commerce de charbons de bois, étant le seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, il vend bien et réalise ainsi des bénéfices considérables sur ses ventes. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de bien satisfaire ses clients, pour mieux les satisfaire il veut agrandir son stock. Il sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Married and the father of three, this gentleman lives with his family in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. In order to provide for his family, he got started in the commerce of charcoal in 2004 and is the only one in this business in his area. Sales are good, so he is realizing considerable profits. His current stock doesn't allow him to satisfy his customers. To do better in satisfying them, he wants to expand his stock. He's therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (340971201) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1997, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Файзали Камолов проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Файзали более 18 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет до конца отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
32-year-oldFaizali K. lives in the Yavan district with his wife and six children. For more than 18 years, Faizali has been engaged in raising livestock. He tends to and sells livestock. The loan he requested is to purchase additional livestock. With the profits of his work, he hopes to finish renovations to his home.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
